CVE-2019-1653
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 97.56%

2 posts

A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of Cisco Small Business RV320 and RV325 Dual Gigabit WAN VPN Routers could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to retrieve sensitive information. The vulnerability is due to improper access controls for URLs. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by connecting to an affected device via HTTP or HTTPS and requesting specific URLs. A

6 repos

https://github.com/k8gege/CiscoExploit

https://github.com/0x27/CiscoRV320Dump

https://github.com/ibrahimzx/CVE-2019-1653

https://github.com/S3ntinelX/nmap-scripts

https://github.com/shaheemirza/CiscoSpill

https://github.com/dubfr33/CVE-2019-1653

simontsui at 2024-01-11T15:49:37.695Z ##

Security Week: China-Linked Volt Typhoon Hackers Possibly Targeting Australian, UK Governments. Chinese state-sponsored hackers are targeting old vulnerabilities in Cisco routers in new attacks apparently aimed at government entities in the US, UK, and Australia, cybersecurity firm SecurityScorecard reports. As part of the observed attacks, the adversaries exploited CVE-2019-1653 and CVE-2019-1652, two critical-severity bugs in discontinued Cisco small business RV320/325 VPN routers, which have been targeted by Chinese hackers before and are also featured in CISA’s KEV catalog.
🔗 https://www.securityweek.com/china-linked-volt-typhoon-hackers-possibly-targeting-australian-uk-governments/

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-11T15:49:37.000Z ##

Security Week: China-Linked Volt Typhoon Hackers Possibly Targeting Australian, UK Governments. Chinese state-sponsored hackers are targeting old vulnerabilities in Cisco routers in new attacks apparently aimed at government entities in the US, UK, and Australia, cybersecurity firm SecurityScorecard reports. As part of the observed attacks, the adversaries exploited CVE-2019-1653 and CVE-2019-1652, two critical-severity bugs in discontinued Cisco small business RV320/325 VPN routers, which have been targeted by Chinese hackers before and are also featured in CISA’s KEV catalog.
🔗 https://www.securityweek.com/china-linked-volt-typhoon-hackers-possibly-targeting-australian-uk-governments/

##

CVE-2021-36260
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 97.48%

4 posts

A command injection vulnerability in the web server of some Hikvision product. Due to the insufficient input validation, attacker can exploit the vulnerability to launch a command injection attack by sending some messages with malicious commands.

9 repos

https://github.com/haingn/HIK-CVE-2021-36260-Exploit

https://github.com/jorhelp/Ingram

https://github.com/r3t4k3r/hikvision_brute

https://github.com/tuntin9x/CheckHKRCE

https://github.com/Aiminsun/CVE-2021-36260

simontsui at 2024-01-18T15:13:57.426Z ##

VulnCheck wrote about 7777-Botnet with the following information:

  • 7777-Botnet remains active, and VulnCheck used co-located services to theorize the botnet is infecting TP-Link, Xiongmai, and Hikvision devices using CVE-2017-7577, CVE-2018-10088, CVE-2022-45460, CVE-2021-36260, and/or CVE-2022-24355.
  • The botnet also appears to infect other systems like MVPower, Zyxel NAS, and GitLab, although at a very low volume.
  • The botnet doesn’t just start a service on port 7777. It also spins up a SOCKS5 server on port 11228.

🔗 https://vulncheck.com/blog/ip-intel-7777-botnet

#7777Botnet #botnet #TPLink #Xiongmai #Hikvision #CVE202177577 #CVE201810088 #CVE202245460 #CVE202136260 #CVE202224355 #MVPower #Zyxel #GitLab

  • The botnet also appears to infect other systems like MVPower, Zyxel NAS, and GitLab, although at a very low volume.
  • The botnet doesn’t just start a service on port 7777. It also spins up a SOCKS5 server on port 11228.

CVE-2017-9841
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 97.48%

4 posts

Util/PHP/eval-stdin.php in PHPUnit starting with 4.8.19 and before 4.8.28, as well as 5.x before 5.6.3, allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary PHP code via HTTP POST data beginning with a `

H3liumb0y at 2024-01-18T10:13:54.148Z ##

"⚠️ Alert: Androxgh0st Botnet Targets AWS & Microsoft Credentials! 🚨"

The cybersecurity realm is on high alert with the emergence of Androxgh0st, a botnet malware exploiting vulnerabilities to steal AWS and Microsoft credentials. It's a Python-scripted threat, targeting sensitive .env files and leveraging SMTP for credential scanning and web shell deployment. Key vulnerabilities exploited include CVE-2017-9841, CVE-2018-15133, and CVE-2021-41773, allowing remote code execution and file uploads. This critical development warrants immediate attention and proactive defense strategies.

Tags: #CyberSecurity #Botnet #Androxgh0st #Vulnerability #AWS #Microsoft #SMTP #PHP #CVE20179841 #CVE201815133 #CVE202141773 #RemoteCodeExecution #CyberAttack

Sources:

  • "Androxgh0st Botnet Malware Steals AWS, Microsoft Credentials" by Tushar Subhra Dutta on GBHackers. https://gbhackers.com/androxgh0st-botnet-malware/
  • "US Gov Issues Warning for Androxgh0st Malware Attacks" by Ionut Arghire on SecurityWeek. https://www.securityweek.com/us-gov-issues-warning-for-androxgh0st-malware-attacks/

Mitre - CVE-2017-9841
Mitre - CVE-2018-15133
Mitre - CVE-2021-41773

##
simontsui at 2024-01-16T17:14:18.401Z ##

Vulnerabilities mentioned in this CISA cybersecurity advisory:

  • CVE-2017-9841 (9.8 critical, disclosed 27 June 2017, added to CISA KEV Catalog 15 February 2022) arbitrary PHP code execution in PHPUnit
  • CVE-2018-15133 (8.1 high, disclosed 09 August 2018, added to KEV 16 January 2024) Laravel Deserialization of Untrusted Data Vulnerability (RCE)
  • CVE-2021-41773 (7.5 high, disclosed 05 October 2021, added to KEV 03 November 2021) Apache HTTP Server Path Traversal Vulnerability (RCE)

#CVE201815133 #KEV #vulnerability #CVE20179841 #CVE202141773 #eitw #activeexploitation

##
H3liumb0y@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-18T10:13:54.000Z ##

"⚠️ Alert: Androxgh0st Botnet Targets AWS & Microsoft Credentials! 🚨"

The cybersecurity realm is on high alert with the emergence of Androxgh0st, a botnet malware exploiting vulnerabilities to steal AWS and Microsoft credentials. It's a Python-scripted threat, targeting sensitive .env files and leveraging SMTP for credential scanning and web shell deployment. Key vulnerabilities exploited include CVE-2017-9841, CVE-2018-15133, and CVE-2021-41773, allowing remote code execution and file uploads. This critical development warrants immediate attention and proactive defense strategies.

Tags: #CyberSecurity #Botnet #Androxgh0st #Vulnerability #AWS #Microsoft #SMTP #PHP #CVE20179841 #CVE201815133 #CVE202141773 #RemoteCodeExecution #CyberAttack

Sources:

  • "Androxgh0st Botnet Malware Steals AWS, Microsoft Credentials" by Tushar Subhra Dutta on GBHackers. https://gbhackers.com/androxgh0st-botnet-malware/
  • "US Gov Issues Warning for Androxgh0st Malware Attacks" by Ionut Arghire on SecurityWeek. https://www.securityweek.com/us-gov-issues-warning-for-androxgh0st-malware-attacks/

Mitre - CVE-2017-9841
Mitre - CVE-2018-15133
Mitre - CVE-2021-41773

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-16T17:14:18.000Z ##

Vulnerabilities mentioned in this CISA cybersecurity advisory:

  • CVE-2017-9841 (9.8 critical, disclosed 27 June 2017, added to CISA KEV Catalog 15 February 2022) arbitrary PHP code execution in PHPUnit
  • CVE-2018-15133 (8.1 high, disclosed 09 August 2018, added to KEV 16 January 2024) Laravel Deserialization of Untrusted Data Vulnerability (RCE)
  • CVE-2021-41773 (7.5 high, disclosed 05 October 2021, added to KEV 03 November 2021) Apache HTTP Server Path Traversal Vulnerability (RCE)

#CVE201815133 #KEV #vulnerability #CVE20179841 #CVE202141773 #eitw #activeexploitation

krlaboratories at 2024-01-13T09:23:04.904Z ##

Виявляється, що незадовго до "зламу століття", сервери Kyivstar мали відомі вразливості.

Як показує кібер-пошукова аналітична система SHODAN, було мінімум 2 публічно доступних RDP, вразливих до CVE-2020-0796 (SMBGhost - RCE).

Були також виявлені публічно доступні пристрої Cisco ASA SSL VPN. В минулому подібні пристрої не раз ставали ціллю та об'єктами APT-атак, їх експлуатували різноманітні Ransomware угрупування, про що йдеться тут: https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2023/08/29/under-siege-rapid7-observed-exploitation-of-cisco-asa-ssl-vpns/

Дякуємо досліднику @whichbuffer за інсайд.

Подейкують, CISO Київстар вже у пошуках нових opportunity. І не дивно!

Як я вже неодноразово писав, на керівні посади Інформаційної безпеки в українські компанії набирають різних некваліфікованих дармоїдів (менеджерів, рекламщиків, піарщиків, бухгалтерів і т.д.), замість того щоб брати талановиту та патріотично налаштовану молодь (власне, тому їх і переманюють іноземні компанії).

#kyivstar #hacking #cybercrime #cyberwar #cybersecurity #infosec #threatintel

##

CVE-2019-1652
(7.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 97.47%

2 posts

A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of Cisco Small Business RV320 and RV325 Dual Gigabit WAN VPN Routers could allow an authenticated, remote attacker with administrative privileges on an affected device to execute arbitrary commands. The vulnerability is due to improper validation of user-supplied input. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending malicious HTTP POST

1 repos

https://github.com/0x27/CiscoRV320Dump

simontsui at 2024-01-11T15:49:37.695Z ##

Security Week: China-Linked Volt Typhoon Hackers Possibly Targeting Australian, UK Governments. Chinese state-sponsored hackers are targeting old vulnerabilities in Cisco routers in new attacks apparently aimed at government entities in the US, UK, and Australia, cybersecurity firm SecurityScorecard reports. As part of the observed attacks, the adversaries exploited CVE-2019-1653 and CVE-2019-1652, two critical-severity bugs in discontinued Cisco small business RV320/325 VPN routers, which have been targeted by Chinese hackers before and are also featured in CISA’s KEV catalog.
🔗 https://www.securityweek.com/china-linked-volt-typhoon-hackers-possibly-targeting-australian-uk-governments/

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-11T15:49:37.000Z ##

Security Week: China-Linked Volt Typhoon Hackers Possibly Targeting Australian, UK Governments. Chinese state-sponsored hackers are targeting old vulnerabilities in Cisco routers in new attacks apparently aimed at government entities in the US, UK, and Australia, cybersecurity firm SecurityScorecard reports. As part of the observed attacks, the adversaries exploited CVE-2019-1653 and CVE-2019-1652, two critical-severity bugs in discontinued Cisco small business RV320/325 VPN routers, which have been targeted by Chinese hackers before and are also featured in CISA’s KEV catalog.
🔗 https://www.securityweek.com/china-linked-volt-typhoon-hackers-possibly-targeting-australian-uk-governments/

CVE-2021-45046
(9.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 97.43%

2 posts

# Impact The fix to address [CVE-2021-44228](https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-44228) in Apache Log4j 2.15.0 was incomplete in certain non-default configurations. This could allow attackers with control over Thread Context Map (MDC) input data when the logging configuration uses a non-default Pattern Layout with either a Context Lookup (for example, $${ctx:loginId}) or a Thread Context Ma

##

CVE-2021-41773
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 97.39%

8 posts

A flaw was found in a change made to path normalization in Apache HTTP Server 2.4.49. An attacker could use a path traversal attack to map URLs to files outside the expected document root. If files outside of the document root are not protected by "require all denied" these requests can succeed. Additionally this flaw could leak the source of interpreted files like CGI scripts. This issue is known

H3liumb0y at 2024-01-18T10:13:54.148Z ##

"⚠️ Alert: Androxgh0st Botnet Targets AWS & Microsoft Credentials! 🚨"

The cybersecurity realm is on high alert with the emergence of Androxgh0st, a botnet malware exploiting vulnerabilities to steal AWS and Microsoft credentials. It's a Python-scripted threat, targeting sensitive .env files and leveraging SMTP for credential scanning and web shell deployment. Key vulnerabilities exploited include CVE-2017-9841, CVE-2018-15133, and CVE-2021-41773, allowing remote code execution and file uploads. This critical development warrants immediate attention and proactive defense strategies.

Tags: #CyberSecurity #Botnet #Androxgh0st #Vulnerability #AWS #Microsoft #SMTP #PHP #CVE20179841 #CVE201815133 #CVE202141773 #RemoteCodeExecution #CyberAttack

Sources:

  • "Androxgh0st Botnet Malware Steals AWS, Microsoft Credentials" by Tushar Subhra Dutta on GBHackers. https://gbhackers.com/androxgh0st-botnet-malware/
  • "US Gov Issues Warning for Androxgh0st Malware Attacks" by Ionut Arghire on SecurityWeek. https://www.securityweek.com/us-gov-issues-warning-for-androxgh0st-malware-attacks/

Mitre - CVE-2017-9841
Mitre - CVE-2018-15133
Mitre - CVE-2021-41773

##
simontsui at 2024-01-16T17:14:18.401Z ##

Vulnerabilities mentioned in this CISA cybersecurity advisory:

  • CVE-2017-9841 (9.8 critical, disclosed 27 June 2017, added to CISA KEV Catalog 15 February 2022) arbitrary PHP code execution in PHPUnit
  • CVE-2018-15133 (8.1 high, disclosed 09 August 2018, added to KEV 16 January 2024) Laravel Deserialization of Untrusted Data Vulnerability (RCE)
  • CVE-2021-41773 (7.5 high, disclosed 05 October 2021, added to KEV 03 November 2021) Apache HTTP Server Path Traversal Vulnerability (RCE)

#CVE201815133 #KEV #vulnerability #CVE20179841 #CVE202141773 #eitw #activeexploitation

##

##

CVE-2017-5487
(5.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 97.18%

2 posts

wp-includes/rest-api/endpoints/class-wp-rest-users-controller.php in the REST API implementation in WordPress 4.7 before 4.7.1 does not properly restrict listings of post authors, which allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive information via a wp-json/wp/v2/users request.

9 repos

https://github.com/GeunSam2/CVE-2017-5487

https://github.com/K3ysTr0K3R/CVE-2017-5487-EXPLOIT

https://github.com/anx0ing/Wordpress_Brute

https://github.com/patilkr/wp-CVE-2017-5487-exploit

https://github.com/zkhalidul/GrabberWP-CVE-2017-5487

https://github.com/teambugsbunny/wpUsersScan

https://github.com/R3K1NG/wpUsersScan

https://github.com/SeasonLeague/CVE-2017-5487

https://github.com/Ravindu-Priyankara/CVE-2017-5487-vulnerability-on-NSBM

An issue was discovered in Joomla! 4.0.0 through 4.2.7. An improper access check allows unauthorized access to webservice endpoints.

We ( @greynoise ) have tags for CVE-2023-29300 (Joomla), CVE-2023-27524 (Apache Superset), CVE-2023-23752 (Coldfusion) and are poking at the others.

Odd spike for Joomla CVE in mid-December.

Be careful out there.

##

CVE-2023-27524
(8.9 HIGH)

EPSS: 96.27%

5 posts

Session Validation attacks in Apache Superset versions up to and including 2.0.1. Installations that have not altered the default configured SECRET_KEY according to installation instructions allow for an attacker to authenticate and access unauthorized resources. This does not affect Superset administrators who have changed the default value for SECRET_KEY config.

10 repos

https://github.com/jakabakos/CVE-2023-27524-Apache-Superset-Auth-Bypass-and-RCE

https://github.com/TardC/CVE-2023-27524

https://github.com/Okaytc/Superset_auth_bypass_check

https://github.com/NguyenCongHaiNam/Research-CVE-2023-27524

https://github.com/antx-code/CVE-2023-27524

https://github.com/necroteddy/CVE-2023-27524

https://github.com/ThatNotEasy/CVE-2023-27524

https://github.com/MaanVader/CVE-2023-27524-POC

https://github.com/horizon3ai/CVE-2023-27524

https://github.com/CN016/Apache-Superset-SECRET_KEY-CVE-2023-27524-

CVE-2024-21887
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 95.69%

76 posts

A command injection vulnerability in web components of Ivanti Connect Secure (9.x, 22.x) and Ivanti Policy Secure (9.x, 22.x) allows an authenticated administrator to send specially crafted requests and execute arbitrary commands on the appliance.

##
simontsui at 2024-01-19T18:33:09.934Z ##

CISA issues Emergency Directive 24-01: Mitigate Ivanti Connect Secure and Ivanti Policy Secure Vulnerabilities in response to CVE-2023-46805 (8.2 high, disclosed by Ivanti on 10 January 2024 as exploited zero-days) authentication bypass in Ivanti Connect Secure VPN Version 9.x and 22.x and CVE-2024-21887 (9.1 critical) command injection in Ivanti Connect Secure VPN Version 9.x and 22.x

🔗 https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/directives/ed-24-01-mitigate-ivanti-connect-secure-and-ivanti-policy-secure-vulnerabilities

#Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #UTA0178 #UNC5221 #CVE202346805 #CVE202421887

##
simontsui at 2024-01-19T15:56:27.654Z ##

Ron Bowes @iagox86 at @greynoise describes payloads leveraging the Ivanti Connect Secure vulnerabilities #CVE202346805 and #CVE202421887 to install cryptominers. IOC provided.
🔗 https://www.greynoise.io/blog/ivanti-connect-secure-exploited-to-install-cryptominers

#threatintel #Ivanti #ConnectSecure #zeroday #vulnerability #eitw #IOC #KEV

##
simontsui at 2024-01-19T12:14:15.521Z ##

AssetNote documents the process they took in reverse engineering the Ivanti Connect Secure vulnerabilities CVE-2023-46805 (Authentication Bypass) & CVE-2024-21887 (Remote Command Execution), as well as understanding potential gaps in other detection mechanisms and exploit payloads that were published. They gave a shoutout to Ron Bowes @iagox86 at @greynoise
🔗 https://www.assetnote.io/resources/research/high-signal-detection-and-exploitation-of-ivantis-pulse-connect-secure-auth-bypass-rce

#AssetNote #Ivanti #ConnectSecure #zeroday #CVE202346805 #CVE202421887 #eitw #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #activeexploitation

##
H3liumb0y at 2024-01-16T08:25:06.984Z ##

"🚨 Ivanti VPN Zero-Day Exploits Unleash Global Cyber Onslaught 🚨"

🔒 Two zero-day vulnerabilities in Ivanti's Connect Secure VPN and Policy Secure network access control (NAC) appliances are facing mass exploitation. Discovered by Volexity, the CVE-2023-46805 and CVE-2024-21887 vulnerabilities enable widespread attacks, impacting businesses of all sizes worldwide, including Fortune 500 companies. The GIFTEDVISITOR webshell variant is used to backdoor systems, indicating a serious threat level.

Ivanti hasn't released patches yet. Administrators are advised to apply vendor-provided mitigation measures and use Ivanti's Integrity Checker Tool. All data on compromised ICS VPN appliances should be considered at risk. Amid these attacks, suspected Chinese state-backed actors (UTA0178 or UNC5221) are notably active, with Mandiant identifying five custom malware strains targeting breached systems.

These include Zipline Passive Backdoor, Thinspool Dropper, Wirefire and Lightwire web shells, Warpwire harvester, PySoxy tunneler, BusyBox, and Thinspool utility. Particularly alarming is Zipline, which intercepts network traffic and supports various malicious activities.

Stay vigilant and prioritize immediate protective actions!

🔗 Source: BleepingComputer - Sergiu Gatlan

Tags: #CyberSecurity #ZeroDay #IvantiVPN #CVE202346805 #CVE202421887 #APT #UTA0178 #UNC5221 #Malware #Webshell #Volexity #Mandiant #NetworkSecurity #InfoSec🛡️🌍👾

##
simontsui at 2024-01-16T01:17:49.542Z ##

Volexity reports the following about CVE-2023-46805 and CVE-2024-21887:

  • Exploitation of these vulnerabilities is now widespread. Volexity has been able to find evidence of compromise of over 1,700 devices worldwide.
  • Additional threat actors beyond UTA0178 appear to now have access to the exploit and are actively trying to exploit devices.

🔗 https://www.volexity.com/blog/2024/01/15/ivanti-connect-secure-vpn-exploitation-goes-global/

#Ivanti #zeroday #eitw #vulnerability #CVE202346805 #CVE202421887 #KEV

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-19T18:33:09.000Z ##

🔗 https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/directives/ed-24-01-mitigate-ivanti-connect-secure-and-ivanti-policy-secure-vulnerabilities

"🚨 Ivanti VPN Zero-Day Exploits Unleash Global Cyber Onslaught 🚨"

🔒 Two zero-day vulnerabilities in Ivanti's Connect Secure VPN and Policy Secure network access control (NAC) appliances are facing mass exploitation. Discovered by Volexity, the CVE-2023-46805 and CVE-2024-21887 vulnerabilities enable widespread attacks, impacting businesses of all sizes worldwide, including Fortune 500 companies. The GIFTEDVISITOR webshell variant is used to backdoor systems, indicating a serious threat level.

Ivanti hasn't released patches yet. Administrators are advised to apply vendor-provided mitigation measures and use Ivanti's Integrity Checker Tool. All data on compromised ICS VPN appliances should be considered at risk. Amid these attacks, suspected Chinese state-backed actors (UTA0178 or UNC5221) are notably active, with Mandiant identifying five custom malware strains targeting breached systems.

These include Zipline Passive Backdoor, Thinspool Dropper, Wirefire and Lightwire web shells, Warpwire harvester, PySoxy tunneler, BusyBox, and Thinspool utility. Particularly alarming is Zipline, which intercepts network traffic and supports various malicious activities.

"🚨 Ivanti VPN Zero-Day Exploits Unleash Global Cyber Onslaught 🚨"

🔒 Two zero-day vulnerabilities in Ivanti's Connect Secure VPN and Policy Secure network access control (NAC) appliances are facing mass exploitation. Discovered by Volexity, the CVE-2023-46805 and CVE-2024-21887 vulnerabilities enable widespread attacks, impacting businesses of all sizes worldwide, including Fortune 500 companies. The GIFTEDVISITOR webshell variant is used to backdoor systems, indicating a serious threat level.

Ivanti hasn't released patches yet. Administrators are advised to apply vendor-provided mitigation measures and use Ivanti's Integrity Checker Tool. All data on compromised ICS VPN appliances should be considered at risk. Amid these attacks, suspected Chinese state-backed actors (UTA0178 or UNC5221) are notably active, with Mandiant identifying five custom malware strains targeting breached systems.

These include Zipline Passive Backdoor, Thinspool Dropper, Wirefire and Lightwire web shells, Warpwire harvester, PySoxy tunneler, BusyBox, and Thinspool utility. Particularly alarming is Zipline, which intercepts network traffic and supports various malicious activities.

Stay vigilant and prioritize immediate protective actions!

"🚨 Ivanti VPN Zero-Day Exploits Unleash Global Cyber Onslaught 🚨"

🔒 Two zero-day vulnerabilities in Ivanti's Connect Secure VPN and Policy Secure network access control (NAC) appliances are facing mass exploitation. Discovered by Volexity, the CVE-2023-46805 and CVE-2024-21887 vulnerabilities enable widespread attacks, impacting businesses of all sizes worldwide, including Fortune 500 companies. The GIFTEDVISITOR webshell variant is used to backdoor systems, indicating a serious threat level.

Ivanti hasn't released patches yet. Administrators are advised to apply vendor-provided mitigation measures and use Ivanti's Integrity Checker Tool. All data on compromised ICS VPN appliances should be considered at risk. Amid these attacks, suspected Chinese state-backed actors (UTA0178 or UNC5221) are notably active, with Mandiant identifying five custom malware strains targeting breached systems.

These include Zipline Passive Backdoor, Thinspool Dropper, Wirefire and Lightwire web shells, Warpwire harvester, PySoxy tunneler, BusyBox, and Thinspool utility. Particularly alarming is Zipline, which intercepts network traffic and supports various malicious activities.

Stay vigilant and prioritize immediate protective actions!

campuscodi@mastodon.social at 2024-01-21T00:58:04.000Z ##

Security researchers from Assetnote have found new ways to exploit the recent Ivanti zero-days (CVE-2023-46805 & CVE-2024-21887) on older versions of the Connect Secure firmware.

https://www.assetnote.io/resources/research/high-signal-detection-and-exploitation-of-ivantis-pulse-connect-secure-auth-bypass-rce

According to GreyNoise, exploitation of these zero-days has extended from a Chinese APT to cryptomining botnets.

https://www.greynoise.io/blog/ivanti-connect-secure-exploited-to-install-cryptominers

##
decio at 2024-01-16T10:22:42.181Z ##

🚨 Comme annoncé par les même chercheurs à l'origine de la découverte initiale, l'exploitation de vulnérabilités dans #Ivanti Connect Secure VPN est devenue généralisée, impliquant des acteurs de menaces opportunistes au-delà du groupe UTA0178.
👇
https://www.volexity.com/blog/2024/01/15/ivanti-connect-secure-vpn-exploitation-goes-global/

Ces vulnérabilités sont désormais et en ce moment même exploitées en masse (❗ ) contre les instances Ivanti exposées sur Internet qui n'ont pas encore appliqué le XML de mitigation proposé
⚠️ 🩹 👇
https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US

Selon ces chercheurs il y aurait actuellement plus de 1 700 appareils compromis à travers le monde.

En image, le nombre d'instances encore vulnérables (❗ ) et exposées sur Internet en Europe selon le moteur de recherche&indexation Shadowserver

Pour les administrateurs de ces systèmes, il est devenu essentiel d'appliquer immédiatement le fichier de mitigation recommandé. Il est également crucial de procéder à une vérification approfondie de l'intégrité de ces systèmes en utilisant le logiciel mis à disposition.
👇
https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB44755?language=en_US

Si une compromission avérée de l'intégrité du système est détectée, ou en présence de comptes inconnus ou anomalies dans les logs, il est alors opportun d'envisager une réinstallation de l'appliance Ivanti. Cette démarche est essentielle pour prévenir de manière efficace toute intrusion d’hôtes indésirables & malintentionnés sur les réseaux internes concernées...

---- Timeline (selon Velexity) ----

03-12-2023 | Première exploitation observée par Volexity.

10-01-2024 | Volexity rapporte les détails de l'exploitation observée de CVE-2024-21887 & CVE-2023-46805.

11-01-2024 | Volexity découvre des preuves que UTA0178 tente une exploitation de masse.

11-01-2024 | Mandiant rapporte ses propres observations.

15-01-2024 | Volexity divulgue des preuves d'exploitation massive et la compromission présumée d'au moins 1700 dispositifs ICS.

#CyberVeille #Ivanti #CVE_2023_46805

##
simontsui at 2024-01-14T15:50:42.369Z ##

watchTowr teases a vulnerability analysis of Ivanti's CVE-2023-46805 & CVE-2024-21887 (exploited zero-days that were disclosed on 10 January 2024 without a patch available yet). They are presumably waiting for the patches to get released around 17 January before they provide a deep dive/PoC.
🔗 https://labs.watchtowr.com/welcome-to-2024-the-sslvpn-chaos-continues-ivanti-cve-2023-46805-cve-2024-21887/

That's not good!

##
h4sh at 2024-01-14T00:00:06.354Z ##

Since #Ivanti hasn't released a patch yet for the #pulsesecure #vpn CVE-2023-46805 & CVE-2024-21887, I have made a nuclei template for scanning whether or not their mitigation XML file has been applied:

https://github.com/projectdiscovery/nuclei-templates/pull/8936

Thanks to @watchtowrcyber (come on, get a real mastodon account!) for their reverse engineering research to make this possible (https://labs.watchtowr.com/welcome-to-2024-the-sslvpn-chaos-continues-ivanti-cve-2023-46805-cve-2024-21887/)

##
simontsui at 2024-01-12T13:21:31.769Z ##

Mandiant published their own blog post regarding the active exploitation of Ivanti zero-days CVE-2023-46805 and CVE-2024-21887. They track the threat actor UTA0178 (Volexity's) as UNC5221, described as a suspected APT. They describe post-exploitation activity and identify custom malware. IOC and Yara rules provided.
🔗 https://www.mandiant.com/resources/blog/suspected-apt-targets-ivanti-zero-day

oversecurity@mastodon.social at 2024-01-11T10:10:03.000Z ##

##
h4sh at 2024-01-10T23:50:49.041Z ##

The mitigation for the Ivanti ICS/IPS #ConnectAround bug is some XML file for now according to https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US

If someone has a copy of that file can you send it to me to have a look?

The actual patch for the bug will be "staggered" across the next few weeks where exploitation by CN APTs will inevitably be much, much faster

##
h4sh at 2024-01-10T23:45:41.790Z ##

demize@unstable.systems at 2024-01-10T22:54:55.000Z ##

(but a mitigation's available, at least!) https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways

##
simontsui at 2024-01-10T18:14:42.257Z ##

Ivanti zero-days: Ivanti Connect Secure (ICS), formerly known as Pulse Connect Secure and Ivanti Policy Secure gateways. "If CVE-2024-21887 is used in conjunction with CVE-2023-46805, exploitation does not require authentication and enables a threat actor to craft malicious requests and execute arbitrary commands on the system."

  • CVE-2023-46805 (8.2 high) authentication bypass
  • CVE-2024-21887 (9.1 critical) command injection

🔗

  • security advisory: https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US
  • blog post: https://www.ivanti.com/blog/security-update-for-ivanti-connect-secure-and-ivanti-policy-secure-gateways
  • knowledge base article: https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US

People are calling them exploited zero-days. There is no patch available at this time: https://cyberplace.social/@GossiTheDog/111732557100241084

EDIT: Are you aware of any active exploitation of the vulnerability?
We are aware of less than 10 customers impacted by the vulnerabilities. We are unable to discuss the specifics of our customers.

campuscodi@mastodon.social at 2024-01-21T00:58:04.000Z ##

Security researchers from Assetnote have found new ways to exploit the recent Ivanti zero-days (CVE-2023-46805 & CVE-2024-21887) on older versions of the Connect Secure firmware.

https://www.assetnote.io/resources/research/high-signal-detection-and-exploitation-of-ivantis-pulse-connect-secure-auth-bypass-rce

According to GreyNoise, exploitation of these zero-days has extended from a Chinese APT to cryptomining botnets.

https://www.greynoise.io/blog/ivanti-connect-secure-exploited-to-install-cryptominers

##
decio@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-16T10:22:42.000Z ##

🚨 Comme annoncé par les même chercheurs à l'origine de la découverte initiale, l'exploitation de vulnérabilités dans #Ivanti Connect Secure VPN est devenue généralisée, impliquant des acteurs de menaces opportunistes au-delà du groupe UTA0178.
👇
https://www.volexity.com/blog/2024/01/15/ivanti-connect-secure-vpn-exploitation-goes-global/

Ces vulnérabilités sont désormais et en ce moment même exploitées en masse (❗ ) contre les instances Ivanti exposées sur Internet qui n'ont pas encore appliqué le XML de mitigation proposé
⚠️ 🩹 👇
https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US

Selon ces chercheurs il y aurait actuellement plus de 1 700 appareils compromis à travers le monde.

En image, le nombre d'instances encore vulnérables (❗ ) et exposées sur Internet en Europe selon le moteur de recherche&indexation Shadowserver

Pour les administrateurs de ces systèmes, il est devenu essentiel d'appliquer immédiatement le fichier de mitigation recommandé. Il est également crucial de procéder à une vérification approfondie de l'intégrité de ces systèmes en utilisant le logiciel mis à disposition.
👇
https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB44755?language=en_US

Si une compromission avérée de l'intégrité du système est détectée, ou en présence de comptes inconnus ou anomalies dans les logs, il est alors opportun d'envisager une réinstallation de l'appliance Ivanti. Cette démarche est essentielle pour prévenir de manière efficace toute intrusion d’hôtes indésirables & malintentionnés sur les réseaux internes concernées...

---- Timeline (selon Velexity) ----

03-12-2023 | Première exploitation observée par Volexity.

10-01-2024 | Volexity rapporte les détails de l'exploitation observée de CVE-2024-21887 & CVE-2023-46805.

11-01-2024 | Volexity découvre des preuves que UTA0178 tente une exploitation de masse.

11-01-2024 | Mandiant rapporte ses propres observations.

15-01-2024 | Volexity divulgue des preuves d'exploitation massive et la compromission présumée d'au moins 1700 dispositifs ICS.

#CyberVeille #Ivanti #CVE_2023_46805

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-14T15:50:42.000Z ##

watchTowr teases a vulnerability analysis of Ivanti's CVE-2023-46805 & CVE-2024-21887 (exploited zero-days that were disclosed on 10 January 2024 without a patch available yet). They are presumably waiting for the patches to get released around 17 January before they provide a deep dive/PoC.
🔗 https://labs.watchtowr.com/welcome-to-2024-the-sslvpn-chaos-continues-ivanti-cve-2023-46805-cve-2024-21887/

##
h4sh@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-14T00:00:06.000Z ##

Since #Ivanti hasn't released a patch yet for the #pulsesecure #vpn CVE-2023-46805 & CVE-2024-21887, I have made a nuclei template for scanning whether or not their mitigation XML file has been applied:

https://github.com/projectdiscovery/nuclei-templates/pull/8936

Thanks to @watchtowrcyber (come on, get a real mastodon account!) for their reverse engineering research to make this possible (https://labs.watchtowr.com/welcome-to-2024-the-sslvpn-chaos-continues-ivanti-cve-2023-46805-cve-2024-21887/)

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-12T13:21:31.000Z ##

Mandiant published their own blog post regarding the active exploitation of Ivanti zero-days CVE-2023-46805 and CVE-2024-21887. They track the threat actor UTA0178 (Volexity's) as UNC5221, described as a suspected APT. They describe post-exploitation activity and identify custom malware. IOC and Yara rules provided.
🔗 https://www.mandiant.com/resources/blog/suspected-apt-targets-ivanti-zero-day

##
h4sh@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-10T23:50:49.000Z ##

The mitigation for the Ivanti ICS/IPS #ConnectAround bug is some XML file for now according to https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US

If someone has a copy of that file can you send it to me to have a look?

The actual patch for the bug will be "staggered" across the next few weeks where exploitation by CN APTs will inevitably be much, much faster

#threatintel

##

CVE-2023-35078
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 95.34%

4 posts

Ivanti Endpoint Manager Mobile (EPMM), formerly MobileIron Core, through 11.10 allows remote attackers to obtain PII, add an administrative account, and change the configuration because of an authentication bypass, as exploited in the wild in July 2023. A patch is available.

6 repos

https://github.com/emanueldosreis/nmap-CVE-2023-35078-Exploit

https://github.com/vchan-in/CVE-2023-35078-Exploit-POC

https://github.com/raytheon0x21/CVE-2023-35078

https://github.com/Blue-number/CVE-2023-35078

https://github.com/lager1/CVE-2023-35078

https://github.com/synfinner/CVE-2023-35078

simontsui at 2024-01-18T20:07:43.271Z ##

There's currently no public reference suggesting that CVE-2023-35082 was being exploited, so CISA may have received inside information from an affected organization. For more information on how CVE-2023-35082 relates to the previously disclosed Ivanti EPMM zero-days see the following excerpt:
"Since CVE-2023-35082 arises from the same place as CVE-2023-35078, specifically the permissive nature of certain entries in the mifs web application’s security filter chain, Rapid7 would consider this new vulnerability a patch bypass for CVE-2023-35078."
Discovered by Rapid7: https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2023/08/02/cve-2023-35082-mobileiron-core-unauthenticated-api-access-vulnerability/

##
simontsui at 2024-01-09T02:39:24.206Z ##

Honestly, I'm surprised that CVE-2023-38203 was added to CISA's KEV Catalog 6 months later. @catc0n of Rapid7 alerted the community to zero-day exploitation using Project Discovery's CVE-2023-38203 technical details and proof of concept exploit around 17 July: https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2023/07/17/etr-active-exploitation-of-multiple-adobe-coldfusion-vulnerabilities/

Then again, that was a wild week/month. Patch Tuesday had Microsoft disclosing 6 actively exploited zero-days; Apple had the WebKit zero-day CVE-2023-37450. This was followed the next week with Citrix CVE-2023-3519, and Ivanti EPMM CVE-2023-35078. #CveCrowdDeny

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-18T20:07:43.000Z ##

There's currently no public reference suggesting that CVE-2023-35082 was being exploited, so CISA may have received inside information from an affected organization. For more information on how CVE-2023-35082 relates to the previously disclosed Ivanti EPMM zero-days see the following excerpt:
"Since CVE-2023-35082 arises from the same place as CVE-2023-35078, specifically the permissive nature of certain entries in the mifs web application’s security filter chain, Rapid7 would consider this new vulnerability a patch bypass for CVE-2023-35078."
Discovered by Rapid7: https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2023/08/02/cve-2023-35082-mobileiron-core-unauthenticated-api-access-vulnerability/

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-09T02:39:24.000Z ##

Honestly, I'm surprised that CVE-2023-38203 was added to CISA's KEV Catalog 6 months later. @catc0n of Rapid7 alerted the community to zero-day exploitation using Project Discovery's CVE-2023-38203 technical details and proof of concept exploit around 17 July: https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2023/07/17/etr-active-exploitation-of-multiple-adobe-coldfusion-vulnerabilities/

Then again, that was a wild week/month. Patch Tuesday had Microsoft disclosing 6 actively exploited zero-days; Apple had the WebKit zero-day CVE-2023-37450. This was followed the next week with Citrix CVE-2023-3519, and Ivanti EPMM CVE-2023-35078. #CveCrowdDeny

##

CVE-2023-29300
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 93.64%

4 posts

Adobe ColdFusion versions 2018u16 (and earlier), 2021u6 (and earlier) and 2023.0.0.330468 (and earlier) are affected by a Deserialization of Untrusted Data vulnerability that could result in Arbitrary code execution. Exploitation of this issue does not require user interaction.

hrbrmstr@mastodon.social at 2024-01-08T16:27:48.000Z ##

🚨 SIX (6) CVEs in today's CISA KEV drop O_O.

We ( @greynoise ) have tags for CVE-2023-29300 (Joomla), CVE-2023-27524 (Apache Superset), CVE-2023-23752 (Coldfusion) and are poking at the others.

Odd spike for Joomla CVE in mid-December.

Be careful out there.

##
simontsui at 2024-01-08T16:19:10.832Z ##

CISA Adds Six Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog:

  • CVE-2023-38203 Adobe ColdFusion Deserialization of Untrusted Data Vulnerability
  • CVE-2023-29300 Adobe ColdFusion Deserialization of Untrusted Data Vulnerability
  • CVE-2023-27524 Apache Superset Insecure Default Initialization of Resource Vulnerability
  • CVE-2023-41990 Apple Multiple Products Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2016-20017 D-Link DSL-2750B Devices Command Injection Vulnerability
  • CVE-2023-23752 Joomla! Improper Access Control Vulnerability

🔗 https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/01/08/cisa-adds-six-known-exploited-vulnerabilities-catalog

##
hrbrmstr@mastodon.social at 2024-01-08T16:27:48.000Z ##

We ( @greynoise ) have tags for CVE-2023-29300 (Joomla), CVE-2023-27524 (Apache Superset), CVE-2023-23752 (Coldfusion) and are poking at the others.

Odd spike for Joomla CVE in mid-December.

Be careful out there.

simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-08T16:19:10.000Z ##

CISA Adds Six Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog:

  • CVE-2023-38203 Adobe ColdFusion Deserialization of Untrusted Data Vulnerability
  • CVE-2023-29300 Adobe ColdFusion Deserialization of Untrusted Data Vulnerability
  • CVE-2023-27524 Apache Superset Insecure Default Initialization of Resource Vulnerability
  • CVE-2023-41990 Apple Multiple Products Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2016-20017 D-Link DSL-2750B Devices Command Injection Vulnerability
  • CVE-2023-23752 Joomla! Improper Access Control Vulnerability

🔗 https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/01/08/cisa-adds-six-known-exploited-vulnerabilities-catalog

##

CVE-2023-35082
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 92.45%

8 posts

An authentication bypass vulnerability in Ivanti EPMM 11.10 and older, allows unauthorized users to access restricted functionality or resources of the application without proper authentication. This vulnerability is unique to CVE-2023-35078 announced earlier.

1 repos

https://github.com/Chocapikk/CVE-2023-35082

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-01-20T11:55:02.000Z ##

U.S. CISA warns of actively exploited Ivanti EPMM flaw CVE-2023-35082 – Source: securityaffairs.com https://ciso2ciso.com/u-s-cisa-warns-of-actively-exploited-ivanti-epmm-flaw-cve-2023-35082-source-securityaffairs-com/ #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #rssfeedpostgeneratorecho #informationsecuritynews #ITInformationSecurity #SecurityAffairscom #CyberSecurityNews #PierluigiPaganini #SecurityAffairs #SecurityAffairs #BreakingNews #SecurityNews #hackingnews #IvantiEPMM #Security #hacking #CISA

##
jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-01-19T18:35:03.000Z ##

Ivanti EPMM and MobileIron Core vulnerability is actively exploited, CISA confirms (CVE-2023-35082) https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2024/01/19/exploited-cve-2023-35082/ #endpointmanagement #vulnerability #Don'tmiss #GreyNoise #exploit #Ivanti #Rapid7 #News #CISA

##
zeljkazorz at 2024-01-19T16:36:34.326Z ##

@simontsui

Ivanti's Knowledge Base article for CVE-2023-35082 (https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-Remote-Unauthenticated-API-Access-Vulnerability-CVE-2023-35082?language=en_US) - ostensibly last updated on August 22, 2023 - states in the FAQ section that "Ivanti has been informed of exploitation by a few customers who have been exploited since the details were made publicly available by Rapid7."

Why hasn't CISA added CVE-2023-35082 to the KEV catalog in August 2023?

I don't know all the ways how CISA gets information about a specific vulnerability being actively exploited. Are (US-based) software companies required to share exploitation info with CISA? Does CISA rely on security advisories (and checking back for updates) for it? Do they rely on compromised organizations flagging vuln exploitation? (I have asked them and will hopefully get some answers.)

##
simontsui at 2024-01-18T20:07:43.271Z ##

There's currently no public reference suggesting that CVE-2023-35082 was being exploited, so CISA may have received inside information from an affected organization. For more information on how CVE-2023-35082 relates to the previously disclosed Ivanti EPMM zero-days see the following excerpt:
"Since CVE-2023-35082 arises from the same place as CVE-2023-35078, specifically the permissive nature of certain entries in the mifs web application’s security filter chain, Rapid7 would consider this new vulnerability a patch bypass for CVE-2023-35078."
Discovered by Rapid7: https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2023/08/02/cve-2023-35082-mobileiron-core-unauthenticated-api-access-vulnerability/

##
simontsui at 2024-01-18T19:46:47.626Z ##

CISA Adds One Known Exploited Vulnerability to Catalog: CVE-2023-35082 (9.8 critical) Ivanti Endpoint Manager Mobile (EPMM) and MobileIron Core Authentication Bypass Vulnerability
🔗 https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/01/18/cisa-adds-one-known-exploited-vulnerability-catalog

@simontsui

Ivanti's Knowledge Base article for CVE-2023-35082 (https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-Remote-Unauthenticated-API-Access-Vulnerability-CVE-2023-35082?language=en_US) - ostensibly last updated on August 22, 2023 - states in the FAQ section that "Ivanti has been informed of exploitation by a few customers who have been exploited since the details were made publicly available by Rapid7."

Why hasn't CISA added CVE-2023-35082 to the KEV catalog in August 2023?

Does CISA rely on security advisories (and checking back for updates) for it? Do they rely on compromised organizations flagging vuln exploitation? (I have asked them and will hopefully get some answers.)

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-18T20:07:43.000Z ##

There's currently no public reference suggesting that CVE-2023-35082 was being exploited, so CISA may have received inside information from an affected organization. For more information on how CVE-2023-35082 relates to the previously disclosed Ivanti EPMM zero-days see the following excerpt:
"Since CVE-2023-35082 arises from the same place as CVE-2023-35078, specifically the permissive nature of certain entries in the mifs web application’s security filter chain, Rapid7 would consider this new vulnerability a patch bypass for CVE-2023-35078."
Discovered by Rapid7: https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2023/08/02/cve-2023-35082-mobileiron-core-unauthenticated-api-access-vulnerability/

##

CVE-2023-46805
(8.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 92.41%

80 posts

An authentication bypass vulnerability in the web component of Ivanti ICS 9.x, 22.x and Ivanti Policy Secure allows a remote attacker to access restricted resources by bypassing control checks.

9 repos

https://github.com/seajaysec/Ivanti-Connect-Around-Scan

https://github.com/rxwx/pulse-meter

https://github.com/duy-31/CVE-2023-46805_CVE-2024-21887

https://github.com/raminkarimkhani1996/CVE-2023-46805_CVE-2024-21887

https://github.com/cbeek-r7/CVE-2023-46805

https://github.com/TheRedDevil1/Check-Vulns-Script

https://github.com/Chocapikk/CVE-2023-46805

https://github.com/yoryio/CVE-2023-46805

https://github.com/mickdec/CVE-2023-46805_CVE-2024-21887_scan_grouped

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-01-19T21:50:02.000Z ##

CISA Issues Emergency Directive on Ivanti Zero-Days https://www.securityweek.com/cisa-issues-emergency-directive-on-ivanti-zero-days/ #Malware&Threats #Vulnerabilities #CVE202346805 #CVE202421887 #Volexity #Ivanti #CISA

##
simontsui at 2024-01-19T18:33:09.934Z ##

CISA issues Emergency Directive 24-01: Mitigate Ivanti Connect Secure and Ivanti Policy Secure Vulnerabilities in response to CVE-2023-46805 (8.2 high, disclosed by Ivanti on 10 January 2024 as exploited zero-days) authentication bypass in Ivanti Connect Secure VPN Version 9.x and 22.x and CVE-2024-21887 (9.1 critical) command injection in Ivanti Connect Secure VPN Version 9.x and 22.x

🔗 https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/directives/ed-24-01-mitigate-ivanti-connect-secure-and-ivanti-policy-secure-vulnerabilities

#Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #UTA0178 #UNC5221 #CVE202346805 #CVE202421887

##
simontsui at 2024-01-19T15:56:27.654Z ##

Ron Bowes @iagox86 at @greynoise describes payloads leveraging the Ivanti Connect Secure vulnerabilities #CVE202346805 and #CVE202421887 to install cryptominers. IOC provided.
🔗 https://www.greynoise.io/blog/ivanti-connect-secure-exploited-to-install-cryptominers

#threatintel #Ivanti #ConnectSecure #zeroday #vulnerability #eitw #IOC #KEV

##
simontsui at 2024-01-19T12:14:15.521Z ##

AssetNote documents the process they took in reverse engineering the Ivanti Connect Secure vulnerabilities CVE-2023-46805 (Authentication Bypass) & CVE-2024-21887 (Remote Command Execution), as well as understanding potential gaps in other detection mechanisms and exploit payloads that were published. They gave a shoutout to Ron Bowes @iagox86 at @greynoise
🔗 https://www.assetnote.io/resources/research/high-signal-detection-and-exploitation-of-ivantis-pulse-connect-secure-auth-bypass-rce

#AssetNote #Ivanti #ConnectSecure #zeroday #CVE202346805 #CVE202421887 #eitw #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #activeexploitation

##
H3liumb0y at 2024-01-16T08:25:06.984Z ##

"🚨 Ivanti VPN Zero-Day Exploits Unleash Global Cyber Onslaught 🚨"

🔒 Two zero-day vulnerabilities in Ivanti's Connect Secure VPN and Policy Secure network access control (NAC) appliances are facing mass exploitation. Discovered by Volexity, the CVE-2023-46805 and CVE-2024-21887 vulnerabilities enable widespread attacks, impacting businesses of all sizes worldwide, including Fortune 500 companies. The GIFTEDVISITOR webshell variant is used to backdoor systems, indicating a serious threat level.

Ivanti hasn't released patches yet. Administrators are advised to apply vendor-provided mitigation measures and use Ivanti's Integrity Checker Tool. All data on compromised ICS VPN appliances should be considered at risk. Amid these attacks, suspected Chinese state-backed actors (UTA0178 or UNC5221) are notably active, with Mandiant identifying five custom malware strains targeting breached systems.

These include Zipline Passive Backdoor, Thinspool Dropper, Wirefire and Lightwire web shells, Warpwire harvester, PySoxy tunneler, BusyBox, and Thinspool utility. Particularly alarming is Zipline, which intercepts network traffic and supports various malicious activities.

Stay vigilant and prioritize immediate protective actions!

🔗 Source: BleepingComputer - Sergiu Gatlan

Tags: #CyberSecurity #ZeroDay #IvantiVPN #CVE202346805 #CVE202421887 #APT #UTA0178 #UNC5221 #Malware #Webshell #Volexity #Mandiant #NetworkSecurity #InfoSec🛡️🌍👾

##
simontsui at 2024-01-16T01:17:49.542Z ##

Volexity reports the following about CVE-2023-46805 and CVE-2024-21887:

  • Exploitation of these vulnerabilities is now widespread. Volexity has been able to find evidence of compromise of over 1,700 devices worldwide.
  • Additional threat actors beyond UTA0178 appear to now have access to the exploit and are actively trying to exploit devices.

🔗 https://www.volexity.com/blog/2024/01/15/ivanti-connect-secure-vpn-exploitation-goes-global/

#Ivanti #zeroday #eitw #vulnerability #CVE202346805 #CVE202421887 #KEV

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-19T18:33:09.000Z ##

🔗 https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/directives/ed-24-01-mitigate-ivanti-connect-secure-and-ivanti-policy-secure-vulnerabilities

🔗 https://www.greynoise.io/blog/ivanti-connect-secure-exploited-to-install-cryptominers

Discovered by Volexity, the CVE-2023-46805 and CVE-2024-21887 vulnerabilities enable widespread attacks, impacting businesses of all sizes worldwide, including Fortune 500 companies. The GIFTEDVISITOR webshell variant is used to backdoor systems, indicating a serious threat level.

Ivanti hasn't released patches yet. Administrators are advised to apply vendor-provided mitigation measures and use Ivanti's Integrity Checker Tool. All data on compromised ICS VPN appliances should be considered at risk. Amid these attacks, suspected Chinese state-backed actors (UTA0178 or UNC5221) are notably active, with Mandiant identifying five custom malware strains targeting breached systems.

These include Zipline Passive Backdoor, Thinspool Dropper, Wirefire and Lightwire web shells, Warpwire harvester, PySoxy tunneler, BusyBox, and Thinspool utility. Particularly alarming is Zipline, which intercepts network traffic and supports various malicious activities.

🔒 Two zero-day vulnerabilities in Ivanti's Connect Secure VPN and Policy Secure network access control (NAC) appliances are facing mass exploitation. Discovered by Volexity, the CVE-2023-46805 and CVE-2024-21887 vulnerabilities enable widespread attacks, impacting businesses of all sizes worldwide, including Fortune 500 companies. Ivanti hasn't released patches yet. Administrators are advised to apply vendor-provided mitigation measures and use Ivanti's Integrity Checker Tool. All data on compromised ICS VPN appliances should be considered at risk. Amid these attacks, suspected Chinese state-backed actors (UTA0178 or UNC5221) are notably active, with Mandiant identifying five custom malware strains targeting breached systems.

These include Zipline Passive Backdoor, Thinspool Dropper, Wirefire and Lightwire web shells, Warpwire harvester, PySoxy tunneler, BusyBox, and Thinspool utility. Particularly alarming is Zipline, which intercepts network traffic and supports various malicious activities.

simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-16T01:17:49.000Z ##

Volexity reports the following about CVE-2023-46805 and CVE-2024-21887:

  • Exploitation of these vulnerabilities is now widespread. Volexity has been able to find evidence of compromise of over 1,700 devices worldwide.

#Ivanti #zeroday #eitw #vulnerability #CVE202346805 #CVE202421887 #KEV

##
decio at 2024-01-19T08:01:21.319Z ##

Nouveau post de Volexity qui
continue l'analyses des attaques en cours et mets en lumière une observation importante pour la correcte application de la mitigation.

⚠️ Attention à la réimportation des backups dans l'appliance
⬇️ ‼️
Plusieurs organisations, après avoir déployé une nouvelle appliance VPN Ivanti et appliqué le XML de mitigation, ont subi une nouvelle compromission.
⬇️
Cela est dû au fait qu'elles ont importé des fichiers de configuration de sauvegarde après avoir appliqué la mitigation, annulant ainsi cette dernière. Volexity souligne l'importance d'appliquer la mitigation après l'importation de toute configuration de sauvegarde pour éviter une nouvelle compromission de l'appareil.
👇
https://www.volexity.com/blog/2024/01/18/ivanti-connect-secure-vpn-exploitation-new-observations/

#cyberveille #ivanti #cve_2023_46805

##
decio at 2024-01-16T13:38:43.369Z ##

Rapid7/AttackerDB a publié l'analyse de la rétro-ingénierie sur le fichier de mitigation d'Ivanti

Ciblage des requêtes dont la réponse a changée sur l'API
de l'appliance et...

"And we can exploit the appliance with a single curl request and achieve unauthenticated OS command execution:" 😬
👇
https://attackerkb.com/topics/AdUh6by52K/cve-2023-46805/rapid7-analysis

#CyberVeille #cve_2023_46805

##
decio at 2024-01-16T10:22:42.181Z ##

🚨 Comme annoncé par les même chercheurs à l'origine de la découverte initiale, l'exploitation de vulnérabilités dans #Ivanti Connect Secure VPN est devenue généralisée, impliquant des acteurs de menaces opportunistes au-delà du groupe UTA0178.
👇
https://www.volexity.com/blog/2024/01/15/ivanti-connect-secure-vpn-exploitation-goes-global/

Ces vulnérabilités sont désormais et en ce moment même exploitées en masse (❗ ) contre les instances Ivanti exposées sur Internet qui n'ont pas encore appliqué le XML de mitigation proposé
⚠️ 🩹 👇
https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US

Selon ces chercheurs il y aurait actuellement plus de 1 700 appareils compromis à travers le monde.

En image, le nombre d'instances encore vulnérables (❗ ) et exposées sur Internet en Europe selon le moteur de recherche&indexation Shadowserver

Pour les administrateurs de ces systèmes, il est devenu essentiel d'appliquer immédiatement le fichier de mitigation recommandé. Il est également crucial de procéder à une vérification approfondie de l'intégrité de ces systèmes en utilisant le logiciel mis à disposition.
👇
https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB44755?language=en_US

Si une compromission avérée de l'intégrité du système est détectée, ou en présence de comptes inconnus ou anomalies dans les logs, il est alors opportun d'envisager une réinstallation de l'appliance Ivanti. Cette démarche est essentielle pour prévenir de manière efficace toute intrusion d’hôtes indésirables & malintentionnés sur les réseaux internes concernées...

---- Timeline (selon Velexity) ----

03-12-2023 | Première exploitation observée par Volexity.

10-01-2024 | Volexity rapporte les détails de l'exploitation observée de CVE-2024-21887 & CVE-2023-46805.

11-01-2024 | Volexity découvre des preuves que UTA0178 tente une exploitation de masse.

11-01-2024 | Mandiant rapporte ses propres observations.

15-01-2024 | Volexity divulgue des preuves d'exploitation massive et la compromission présumée d'au moins 1700 dispositifs ICS.

#CyberVeille #Ivanti #CVE_2023_46805

##
decio@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-19T08:01:21.000Z ##

Nouveau post de Volexity qui
continue l'analyses des attaques en cours et mets en lumière une observation importante pour la correcte application de la mitigation.

⚠️ Attention à la réimportation des backups dans l'appliance
⬇️ ‼️
Plusieurs organisations, après avoir déployé une nouvelle appliance VPN Ivanti et appliqué le XML de mitigation, ont subi une nouvelle compromission.
⬇️
Cela est dû au fait qu'elles ont importé des fichiers de configuration de sauvegarde après avoir appliqué la mitigation, annulant ainsi cette dernière. Volexity souligne l'importance d'appliquer la mitigation après l'importation de toute configuration de sauvegarde pour éviter une nouvelle compromission de l'appareil.
👇
https://www.volexity.com/blog/2024/01/18/ivanti-connect-secure-vpn-exploitation-new-observations/

#cyberveille #ivanti #cve_2023_46805

##
decio@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-16T13:38:43.000Z ##

Rapid7/AttackerDB a publié l'analyse de la rétro-ingénierie sur le fichier de mitigation d'Ivanti

Ciblage des requêtes dont la réponse a changée sur l'API
de l'appliance et...

"And we can exploit the appliance with a single curl request and achieve unauthenticated OS command execution:" 😬
👇
https://attackerkb.com/topics/AdUh6by52K/cve-2023-46805/rapid7-analysis

#CyberVeille #cve_2023_46805

##
decio@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-16T10:22:42.000Z ##

🚨 Comme annoncé par les même chercheurs à l'origine de la découverte initiale, l'exploitation de vulnérabilités dans #Ivanti Connect Secure VPN est devenue généralisée, impliquant des acteurs de menaces opportunistes au-delà du groupe UTA0178.
👇
https://www.volexity.com/blog/2024/01/15/ivanti-connect-secure-vpn-exploitation-goes-global/

Ces vulnérabilités sont désormais et en ce moment même exploitées en masse (❗ ) contre les instances Ivanti exposées sur Internet qui n'ont pas encore appliqué le XML de mitigation proposé
⚠️ 🩹 👇
https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US

Selon ces chercheurs il y aurait actuellement plus de 1 700 appareils compromis à travers le monde.

En image, le nombre d'instances encore vulnérables (❗ ) et exposées sur Internet en Europe selon le moteur de recherche&indexation Shadowserver

Pour les administrateurs de ces systèmes, il est devenu essentiel d'appliquer immédiatement le fichier de mitigation recommandé. Il est également crucial de procéder à une vérification approfondie de l'intégrité de ces systèmes en utilisant le logiciel mis à disposition.
👇
https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB44755?language=en_US

Si une compromission avérée de l'intégrité du système est détectée, ou en présence de comptes inconnus ou anomalies dans les logs, il est alors opportun d'envisager une réinstallation de l'appliance Ivanti. Cette démarche est essentielle pour prévenir de manière efficace toute intrusion d’hôtes indésirables & malintentionnés sur les réseaux internes concernées...

---- Timeline (selon Velexity) ----

03-12-2023 | Première exploitation observée par Volexity.

10-01-2024 | Volexity rapporte les détails de l'exploitation observée de CVE-2024-21887 & CVE-2023-46805.

11-01-2024 | Volexity découvre des preuves que UTA0178 tente une exploitation de masse.

11-01-2024 | Mandiant rapporte ses propres observations.

15-01-2024 | Volexity divulgue des preuves d'exploitation massive et la compromission présumée d'au moins 1700 dispositifs ICS.

#CyberVeille #Ivanti #CVE_2023_46805

##
campuscodi@mastodon.social at 2024-01-21T00:58:04.000Z ##

Security researchers from Assetnote have found new ways to exploit the recent Ivanti zero-days (CVE-2023-46805 & CVE-2024-21887) on older versions of the Connect Secure firmware.

https://www.assetnote.io/resources/research/high-signal-detection-and-exploitation-of-ivantis-pulse-connect-secure-auth-bypass-rce

According to GreyNoise, exploitation of these zero-days has extended from a Chinese APT to cryptomining botnets.

https://www.greynoise.io/blog/ivanti-connect-secure-exploited-to-install-cryptominers

##
jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-01-18T23:05:02.000Z ##

ntkramer at 2024-01-16T18:08:11.347Z ##

🥪 & #threatintel: we just got a tag up for the Ivanti goodness of late (CVE-2023-46805, CVE-2024-21887) based on the Metasploit module that was published. As expected with this 0-day, we haven't seen hits on our global fleet, but this will change very quickly now.

https://viz.greynoise.io/tag/ivanti-connect-secure-rce-attempt?days=30

##
GossiTheDog@cyberplace.social at 2024-01-16T14:49:29.000Z ##

Complete exploitation info for #ConnectAround is now public. https://attackerkb.com/topics/AdUh6by52K/cve-2023-46805

It’s a chaotic mix of ../../ directory traversal and open APIs… if you haven’t applied the mitigations you’re going to have a really bad time as ransomware groups will jump on the train soon. #threatintel

jbhall56 at 2024-01-16T14:06:00.481Z ##

As discovered by threat intelligence company Volexity multiple threat groups chain the CVE-2023-46805 authentication bypass and the CVE-2024-21887 command injection vulnerabilities in widespread attacks starting January 11. https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/ivanti-connect-secure-zero-days-now-under-mass-exploitation

simontsui at 2024-01-14T15:50:42.369Z ##

watchTowr teases a vulnerability analysis of Ivanti's CVE-2023-46805 & CVE-2024-21887 (exploited zero-days that were disclosed on 10 January 2024 without a patch available yet). They are presumably waiting for the patches to get released around 17 January before they provide a deep dive/PoC.
🔗 https://labs.watchtowr.com/welcome-to-2024-the-sslvpn-chaos-continues-ivanti-cve-2023-46805-cve-2024-21887/

h4sh at 2024-01-14T00:00:06.354Z ##

Since #Ivanti hasn't released a patch yet for the #pulsesecure #vpn CVE-2023-46805 & CVE-2024-21887, I have made a nuclei template for scanning whether or not their mitigation XML file has been applied:

https://github.com/projectdiscovery/nuclei-templates/pull/8936

Thanks to @watchtowrcyber (come on, get a real mastodon account!) for their reverse engineering research to make this possible (https://labs.watchtowr.com/welcome-to-2024-the-sslvpn-chaos-continues-ivanti-cve-2023-46805-cve-2024-21887/)

decio at 2024-01-13T17:14:36.093Z ##

i feel it & fully agree in both style and substance 👍

"It’s almost heartwarming to see our supplier finally roll out security patches, albeit at a pace that would embarrass a snail. In the meantime, while we wait with bated breath, this could be an excellent moment to ponder whether our current VPN provider is a champion of cybersecurity or just a champion of testing our patience."
👇

##
simontsui at 2024-01-12T13:21:31.769Z ##

Mandiant published their own blog post regarding the active exploitation of Ivanti zero-days CVE-2023-46805 and CVE-2024-21887. They track the threat actor UTA0178 (Volexity's) as UNC5221, described as a suspected APT. They describe post-exploitation activity and identify custom malware. IOC and Yara rules provided.
🔗 https://www.mandiant.com/resources/blog/suspected-apt-targets-ivanti-zero-day

##
h4sh at 2024-01-10T23:50:49.041Z ##

The mitigation for the Ivanti ICS/IPS #ConnectAround bug is some XML file for now according to https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US

If someone has a copy of that file can you send it to me to have a look?

The actual patch for the bug will be "staggered" across the next few weeks where exploitation by CN APTs will inevitably be much, much faster

##
demize@unstable.systems at 2024-01-10T22:54:55.000Z ##

the incident response christmas gift is a little late getting unwrapped this year:

unauthenticated arbitrary remote code execution on Ivanti/PulseSecure gateways! no patch for at least 12 more days! (but a mitigation's available, at least!) https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways

also, "you cannot tell from logs if the server is being exploited"! https://www.volexity.com/blog/2024/01/10/active-exploitation-of-two-zero-day-vulnerabilities-in-ivanti-connect-secure-vpn/

##
GossiTheDog@cyberplace.social at 2024-01-10T22:19:22.000Z ##

CISA have added the two CVEs ( CVE-2024-21887 and CVE-2023-46805 ) to KEV, and are requiring mitigation application on Federal Civilian Executive Branch (FCEB) agency networks by 31st January 2024. https://www.cisa.gov/known-exploited-vulnerabilities-catalog #ConnectAround #threatintel

##
simontsui at 2024-01-10T20:41:08.660Z ##

CISA put out a cybersecurity alert: Ivanti Releases Security Update for Connect Secure and Policy Secure Gateways.
"Ivanti reports active exploitation of both CVE-2023-46805 and CVE-2024-21887."
🔗 https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/01/10/ivanti-releases-security-update-connect-secure-and-policy-secure-gateways

simontsui at 2024-01-10T20:29:33.981Z ##

🔗 EDIT: link to CISA alert: https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/01/10/cisa-adds-two-known-exploited-vulnerabilities-catalog

simontsui at 2024-01-10T20:14:57.542Z ##

##
GossiTheDog@cyberplace.social at 2024-01-10T19:50:54.000Z ##

Ivanti have moved the knowledge base for the vuln from login only to publicly viewable: https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US

##
GossiTheDog@cyberplace.social at 2024-01-10T18:26:04.000Z ##

This is definitely being actively used in the wild - Ivanti have opted to hide that part behind a paywall. Paywall link: https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways

##
simontsui at 2024-01-10T18:14:42.257Z ##

Ivanti zero-days: Ivanti Connect Secure (ICS), formerly known as Pulse Connect Secure and Ivanti Policy Secure gateways. "If CVE-2024-21887 is used in conjunction with CVE-2023-46805, exploitation does not require authentication and enables a threat actor to craft malicious requests and execute arbitrary commands on the system."

  • CVE-2023-46805 (8.2 high) authentication bypass
  • CVE-2024-21887 (9.1 critical) command injection

🔗

  • security advisory: https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US
  • blog post: https://www.ivanti.com/blog/security-update-for-ivanti-connect-secure-and-ivanti-policy-secure-gateways
  • knowledge base article: https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US

People are calling them exploited zero-days. There is no patch available at this time: https://cyberplace.social/@GossiTheDog/111732557100241084

EDIT: Are you aware of any active exploitation of the vulnerability?
We are aware of less than 10 customers impacted by the vulnerabilities. We are unable to discuss the specifics of our customers.

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-10T20:14:57.000Z ##

CISA plans to add CVE-2023-46805 (8.2 high) CVE-2024-21887 (9.1 critical) to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog today.

##
GossiTheDog@cyberplace.social at 2024-01-10T19:50:54.000Z ##

Ivanti have moved the knowledge base for the vuln from login only to publicly viewable: https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US

##
GossiTheDog@cyberplace.social at 2024-01-10T18:26:04.000Z ##

This is definitely being actively used in the wild - Ivanti have opted to hide that part behind a paywall. Paywall link: https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-10T18:14:42.000Z ##

Ivanti zero-days: Ivanti Connect Secure (ICS), formerly known as Pulse Connect Secure and Ivanti Policy Secure gateways. "If CVE-2024-21887 is used in conjunction with CVE-2023-46805, exploitation does not require authentication and enables a threat actor to craft malicious requests and execute arbitrary commands on the system."

  • CVE-2023-46805 (8.2 high) authentication bypass
  • CVE-2024-21887 (9.1 critical) command injection

🔗

  • security advisory: https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US
  • blog post: https://www.ivanti.com/blog/security-update-for-ivanti-connect-secure-and-ivanti-policy-secure-gateways
  • knowledge base article: https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US

People are calling them exploited zero-days. There is no patch available at this time: https://cyberplace.social/@GossiTheDog/111732557100241084

EDIT: Are you aware of any active exploitation of the vulnerability?
We are aware of less than 10 customers impacted by the vulnerabilities. We are unable to discuss the specifics of our customers.

simontsui at 2024-01-09T02:39:24.206Z ##

Honestly, I'm surprised that CVE-2023-38203 was added to CISA's KEV Catalog 6 months later. @catc0n of Rapid7 alerted the community to zero-day exploitation using Project Discovery's CVE-2023-38203 technical details and proof of concept exploit around 17 July: https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2023/07/17/etr-active-exploitation-of-multiple-adobe-coldfusion-vulnerabilities/

Then again, that was a wild week/month. Patch Tuesday had Microsoft disclosing 6 actively exploited zero-days; Apple had the WebKit zero-day CVE-2023-37450. This was followed the next week with Citrix CVE-2023-3519, and Ivanti EPMM CVE-2023-35078. #CveCrowdDeny

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-09T02:39:24.000Z ##

Honestly, I'm surprised that CVE-2023-38203 was added to CISA's KEV Catalog 6 months later. @catc0n of Rapid7 alerted the community to zero-day exploitation using Project Discovery's CVE-2023-38203 technical details and proof of concept exploit around 17 July: https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2023/07/17/etr-active-exploitation-of-multiple-adobe-coldfusion-vulnerabilities/

Then again, that was a wild week/month. Patch Tuesday had Microsoft disclosing 6 actively exploited zero-days; Apple had the WebKit zero-day CVE-2023-37450. This was followed the next week with Citrix CVE-2023-3519, and Ivanti EPMM CVE-2023-35078. #CveCrowdDeny

CVE-2023-39143

EPSS: 88.08%

2 posts

PaperCut NG and PaperCut MF before 22.1.3 are vulnerable to path traversal which enables attackers to read, delete, and upload arbitrary files.

1 repos

simontsui at 2024-01-12T14:59:15.205Z ##

Horizon3.ai posted technical deep dives into two vulnerabilities:

  • CVE-2023-39143 (9.8 critical, disclosed 25 July 2023 by PaperCut) path traversal in PaperCut NG/MF before 22.1.3 allowing for arbitrary file upload/read/delete and RCE
  • CVE-2023-43208 (9.8 critical, disclosed 25 October 2023 by Horizon3) unauthenticated RCE in NextGen’s Mirth Connect

🔗 https://www.horizon3.ai/writeup-for-cve-2023-39143-papercut-webdav-vulnerability/ and https://www.horizon3.ai/writeup-for-cve-2023-43208-nextgen-mirth-connect-pre-auth-rce/

##

CVE-2023-48795
(5.9 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 65.66%

4 posts

### Summary Terrapin is a prefix truncation attack targeting the SSH protocol. More precisely, Terrapin breaks the integrity of SSH's secure channel. By carefully adjusting the sequence numbers during the handshake, an attacker can remove an arbitrary amount of messages sent by the client or server at the beginning of the secure channel without the client or server noticing it. ### Mitigations

simontsui at 2024-01-09T21:23:56.533Z ##

Fortinet confirms that the Terrapin attack CVE-2023-48795 does not affect FortiADC, FortiADC-Manager, and FortiAIOps. They are investigating the other products. They provide a workaround just in case.
🔗 https://fortiguard.fortinet.com/psirt/FG-IR-23-490

##
simontsui at 2024-01-09T20:18:28.761Z ##

Happy Patch Tuesday: Fortinet security advisories:

  • CVE-2023-48795 (5.3 medium): OpenSSH Terrapin attack (third party)
  • CVE-2023-37932 (6.2 medium): FortiVoice - Path traversal vulnerability in administrative interface
  • CVE-2023-48783 (4.9 medium): FortiPortal - Insufficient Access Control over API endpoints
  • CVE-2023-46712 (6.3 medium): FortiPortal - Account creation outside initial IdP
  • CVE-2023-37934 (4.2 medium): FortiPAM - Lack of rate control to protect against DoS attacks
  • CVE-2023-44250 (8.8 high): FortiOS & FortiProxy - Improper authorization for HA requests

No mention of exploitation.

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-09T21:23:56.000Z ##

Fortinet confirms that the Terrapin attack CVE-2023-48795 does not affect FortiADC, FortiADC-Manager, and FortiAIOps. They are investigating the other products. They provide a workaround just in case.
🔗 https://fortiguard.fortinet.com/psirt/FG-IR-23-490

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-09T20:18:28.000Z ##

  • CVE-2023-48795 (5.3 medium): OpenSSH Terrapin attack (third party)
  • CVE-2023-37932 (6.2 medium): FortiVoice - Path traversal vulnerability in administrative interface

  • CVE-2023-46712 (6.3 medium): FortiPortal - Account creation outside initial IdP

CVE-2018-15133
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 62.42%

12 posts

In Laravel Framework through 5.5.40 and 5.6.x through 5.6.29, remote code execution might occur as a result of an unserialize call on a potentially untrusted X-XSRF-TOKEN value. This involves the decrypt method in `Illuminate/Encryption/Encrypter.php` and PendingBroadcast in `gadgetchains/Laravel/RCE/3/chain.php` in phpggc. The attacker must know the application key, which normally would never occ

11 repos

https://github.com/0xSalle/cve-2018-15133

https://github.com/kozmic/laravel-poc-CVE-2018-15133

https://github.com/Cr4zyD14m0nd137/Lab-for-cve-2018-15133

H3liumb0y at 2024-01-18T10:13:54.148Z ##

"⚠️ Alert: Androxgh0st Botnet Targets AWS & Microsoft Credentials! 🚨"

The cybersecurity realm is on high alert with the emergence of Androxgh0st, a botnet malware exploiting vulnerabilities to steal AWS and Microsoft credentials. It's a Python-scripted threat, targeting sensitive .env files and leveraging SMTP for credential scanning and web shell deployment. Key vulnerabilities exploited include CVE-2017-9841, CVE-2018-15133, and CVE-2021-41773, allowing remote code execution and file uploads. This critical development warrants immediate attention and proactive defense strategies.

Tags: #CyberSecurity #Botnet #Androxgh0st #Vulnerability #AWS #Microsoft #SMTP #PHP #CVE20179841 #CVE201815133 #CVE202141773 #RemoteCodeExecution #CyberAttack

Sources:

  • "Androxgh0st Botnet Malware Steals AWS, Microsoft Credentials" by Tushar Subhra Dutta on GBHackers. https://gbhackers.com/androxgh0st-botnet-malware/
  • "US Gov Issues Warning for Androxgh0st Malware Attacks" by Ionut Arghire on SecurityWeek. https://www.securityweek.com/us-gov-issues-warning-for-androxgh0st-malware-attacks/

Mitre - CVE-2017-9841
Mitre - CVE-2018-15133
Mitre - CVE-2021-41773

##
simontsui at 2024-01-16T17:14:18.401Z ##

Vulnerabilities mentioned in this CISA cybersecurity advisory:

  • CVE-2017-9841 (9.8 critical, disclosed 27 June 2017, added to CISA KEV Catalog 15 February 2022) arbitrary PHP code execution in PHPUnit
  • CVE-2018-15133 (8.1 high, disclosed 09 August 2018, added to KEV 16 January 2024) Laravel Deserialization of Untrusted Data Vulnerability (RCE)
  • CVE-2021-41773 (7.5 high, disclosed 05 October 2021, added to KEV 03 November 2021) Apache HTTP Server Path Traversal Vulnerability (RCE)

#CVE201815133 #KEV #vulnerability #CVE20179841 #CVE202141773 #eitw #activeexploitation

##
simontsui at 2024-01-16T17:10:38.639Z ##

Hot off the press: CISA adds CVE-2018-15133 (8.1 high, disclosed 09 August 2018) Laravel Deserialization of Untrusted Data Vulnerability to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog. No official press release yet
🔗 https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/01/16/cisa-adds-one-known-exploited-vulnerability-catalog

cc: @hrbrmstr

CVE-2023-51467(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 54.47%

5 posts

The vulnerability allows attackers to bypass authentication to achieve a simple Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF)

VulnCheck was able to weaponize CVE-2023-51467 (9.8 critical, disclosed 26 December 2023 by SonicWall) Apache OFBiz Pre-auth RCE. They were able to achieve arbitrary in memory code execution. PoC exploit shared.

##

CVE-2023-38203
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 50.97%

4 posts

Adobe ColdFusion versions 2018u17 (and earlier), 2021u7 (and earlier) and 2023u1 (and earlier) are affected by a Deserialization of Untrusted Data vulnerability that could result in Arbitrary code execution. Exploitation of this issue does not require user interaction.

simontsui at 2024-01-09T02:39:24.206Z ##

Honestly, I'm surprised that CVE-2023-38203 was added to CISA's KEV Catalog 6 months later. @catc0n of Rapid7 alerted the community to zero-day exploitation using Project Discovery's CVE-2023-38203 technical details and proof of concept exploit around 17 July: https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2023/07/17/etr-active-exploitation-of-multiple-adobe-coldfusion-vulnerabilities/

Then again, that was a wild week/month. Patch Tuesday had Microsoft disclosing 6 actively exploited zero-days; Apple had the WebKit zero-day CVE-2023-37450. This was followed the next week with Citrix CVE-2023-3519, and Ivanti EPMM CVE-2023-35078. #CveCrowdDeny

##
simontsui at 2024-01-08T16:19:10.832Z ##

CISA Adds Six Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog:

  • CVE-2023-38203 Adobe ColdFusion Deserialization of Untrusted Data Vulnerability
  • CVE-2023-29300 Adobe ColdFusion Deserialization of Untrusted Data Vulnerability
  • CVE-2023-27524 Apache Superset Insecure Default Initialization of Resource Vulnerability
  • CVE-2023-41990 Apple Multiple Products Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2016-20017 D-Link DSL-2750B Devices Command Injection Vulnerability
  • CVE-2023-23752 Joomla! Improper Access Control Vulnerability

🔗 https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/01/08/cisa-adds-six-known-exploited-vulnerabilities-catalog

##
