##

CVE-2023-29357
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 10.70%

15 posts

Microsoft SharePoint Server Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability

5 repos

https://github.com/Twil4/CVE-2023-29357-check

https://github.com/Guillaume-Risch/cve-2023-29357-Sharepoint

https://github.com/LuemmelSec/CVE-2023-29357

https://github.com/Chocapikk/CVE-2023-29357

https://github.com/KeyStrOke95/CVE-2023-29357-ExE

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-01-15T11:20:02.000Z ##

Explotación activa de vulnerabilidad Microsoft SharePoint Server CVE-2023-29357 https://blog.elhacker.net/2024/01/explotacion-activa-vulnerabilidad-microsoft-sharepoint.html #estadosunidos #sharepoint #microsoft #CISA

##
jbhall56 at 2024-01-13T16:42:54.620Z ##

Tracked as CVE-2023-29357, the security flaw enables remote attackers to get admin privileges on unpatched servers by circumventing authentication using spoofed JWT auth tokens. https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/cisa-critical-microsoft-sharepoint-bug-now-actively-exploited/#google_vignette

##
LMGsecurity at 2024-01-11T18:39:04.279Z ##

CISA adds critical #SharePoint vuln CVE-2023-29357 to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities catalog & suggests immediate patching. A patch is available, but CISA's move likely indicates the vulnerability is being actively exploited. https://www.securityweek.com/cisa-urges-patching-of-exploited-sharepoint-server-vulnerability/
#cybersecurity #DFIR

##
campuscodi@mastodon.social at 2024-01-11T18:02:43.000Z ##

CISA says that threat actors are exploiting a vulnerability in Microsoft SharePoint servers.

Tracked as CVE-2023-29357, the bug was patched in June of last year.

The vulnerability is an elevation of privilege that can be chained with other SharePoint bugs to achieve remote code execution attacks.

Loads of technical write-ups and public PoCs on how to perform such attacks have been available online since September of last year.

https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/01/10/cisa-adds-one-known-exploited-vulnerability-catalog

##
simontsui at 2024-01-11T17:01:46.667Z ##

@GossiTheDog @nopatience For recordkeeping purposes, can you identify which ransomware group is using CVE-2023-29357 and if there's an available source?

##
nopatience@swecyb.com at 2024-01-11T15:36:11.000Z ##

A vulnerability in Microsoft Sharepoint, originally patched back in September (CVE-2023-29357) have since yesterday appeared in CISA KEV meaning there's known exploitation of said vulnerability.

@GossiTheDog called this out already back in September, but not sure if we ever saw the predicted ransomware attacks.

https://www.cisa.gov/known-exploited-vulnerabilities-catalog

#Microsoft #SharePoint #Vulnerability #ThreatIntel

##
jbhall56 at 2024-01-11T13:21:06.993Z ##

The security defect, tracked as CVE-2023-29357 (CVSS score of 9.8) and patched on June 2023 Patch Tuesday, is described as an elevation of privilege (EoP) flaw that allows unauthenticated attackers to gain administrator privileges. https://www.securityweek.com/cisa-urges-patching-of-exploited-sharepoint-server-vulnerability/

##
simontsui at 2024-01-10T16:40:17.985Z ##

CVE-2023-29357 (9.8 critical, disclosed 13 June 2023 on Patch Tuesday) Microsoft SharePoint Server Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
🔗 https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/01/10/cisa-adds-one-known-exploited-vulnerability-catalog

##

CVE-2023-50164
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 9.72%

8 posts

An attacker can manipulate file upload params to enable paths traversal and under some circumstances this can lead to uploading a malicious file which can be used to perform Remote Code Execution. Users are recommended to upgrade to versions Struts 2.5.33 or Struts 6.3.0.2 or greater to fix this issue.

10 repos

https://github.com/Trackflaw/CVE-2023-50164-ApacheStruts2-Docker

https://github.com/helsecert/cve-2023-50164

https://github.com/sunnyvale-it/CVE-2023-50164-PoC

https://github.com/dwisiswant0/cve-2023-50164-poc

https://github.com/Thirukrishnan/CVE-2023-50164-Apache-Struts-RCE

https://github.com/snyk-labs/CVE-2023-50164-POC

https://github.com/bcdannyboy/CVE-2023-50164

https://github.com/aaronm-sysdig/cve-2023-50164

https://github.com/jakabakos/CVE-2023-50164-Apache-Struts-RCE

https://github.com/miles3719/cve-2023-50164

simontsui at 2024-01-17T16:34:13.910Z ##

@GossiTheDog Didn't Cisco announce that their Identity Services Engine (ISE) was vulnerable to CVE-2023-50164 on December 12th? https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-struts-C2kCMkmT

And Oracle pushed patches for CVE-2023-50164 affecting Communication Policy Management, Hyperion Infrastructure Technology and MySQL Enterprise Monitor yesterday: https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpujan2024.html

##
GossiTheDog@cyberplace.social at 2024-01-17T16:22:46.000Z ##

We have the first vendor product actually vulnerable to that Apache Struts vuln from December 2023 - CVE-2023-50164.

Product: Trackplus Allegra
Tailored POC: https://srcincite.io/pocs/src-2024-0001.py.txt
Advisory: https://srcincite.io/advisories/src-2024-0001/

Complete with ../.. directory traversal too.

Disclosure Timeline:

2023-11-08 – Vulnerability reported to security@struts.apache.org

2023-12-21 – Silently patched by the vendor

Shodan search: title:"Allegra" html:"trackplus"

##
simontsui at 2024-01-17T12:57:57.262Z ##

Oracle confirms that the Apache Struts 2 RCE vulnerability CVE-2023-50164 affects three products and provided patches against these vulnerable versions:

  • Oracle Communications Policy Management 12.6.1.0.0, 15.0.0.0.0
  • Oracle Hyperion Infrastructure Technology 11.2.14.0.000
  • Oracle MySQL Enterprise Monitor 8.0.36 and prior

🔗 https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpujan2024.html

#Apache #Struts2 #CVE202350164 #OracleCriticalPatchUpdate

##
GossiTheDog@cyberplace.social at 2024-01-12T23:13:05.000Z ##

Finally had a single honeypot hit for CVE-2023-50164 on Greynoise.

It the record I haven’t heard of a single org having an incident with this vuln, before anybody gets too excited.

##

##

CVE-2022-41328
(7.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 5.86%

4 posts

A improper limitation of a pathname to a restricted directory vulnerability ('path traversal') [CWE-22] in Fortinet FortiOS version 7.2.0 through 7.2.3, 7.0.0 through 7.0.9 and before 6.4.11 allows a privileged attacker to read and write files on the underlying Linux system via crafted CLI commands.

simontsui at 2024-01-19T17:33:52.738Z ##

UNC3886 is a Chinese state-sponsored cyberespionage group that has targeted and exploited zero-day vulnerabilities in firewall and virtualization technologies, which do not support EDR solutions. UNC3886 has primarily targeted defense, technology, and telecommunication organizations located in the US and APJ regions. First public reporting on UNC3886 exploitation came from Mandiant on 29 September 2022.

UNC886 has been known to leverage the following vulnerabilities:

  • CVE-2022-41328 (7.1 high, disclosed 07 March 2023, in KEV) Fortinet FortiOS local directory traversal leads to arbitrary read/write
  • CVE-2023-20867 (3.9 low, disclosed 13 June 2023 by VMware, in KEV, VMware Tools Authentication Bypass)
  • CVE-2023-34048 (9.8 critical, disclosed 25 Octover 2023, under active exploitation, VMware vCenter Server Out-of-Bounds Write Vulnerability to RCE)

#UNC3886 #CVE202241328 #CVE202320867 #CVE202334048 #VMware #vCenter #RCE #FortiOS #KEV #China #cyberespionage #VMwaretools #APT

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-19T17:33:52.000Z ##

UNC3886 is a Chinese state-sponsored cyberespionage group that has targeted and exploited zero-day vulnerabilities in firewall and virtualization technologies, which do not support EDR solutions. UNC3886 has primarily targeted defense, technology, and telecommunication organizations located in the US and APJ regions. First public reporting on UNC3886 exploitation came from Mandiant on 29 September 2022.

UNC886 has been known to leverage the following vulnerabilities:

  • CVE-2022-41328 (7.1 high, disclosed 07 March 2023, in KEV) Fortinet FortiOS local directory traversal leads to arbitrary read/write
  • CVE-2023-20867 (3.9 low, disclosed 13 June 2023 by VMware, in KEV, VMware Tools Authentication Bypass)
  • CVE-2023-34048 (9.8 critical, disclosed 25 Octover 2023, under active exploitation, VMware vCenter Server Out-of-Bounds Write Vulnerability to RCE)

#UNC3886 #CVE202241328 #CVE202320867 #CVE202334048 #VMware #vCenter #RCE #FortiOS #KEV #China #cyberespionage #VMwaretools #APT

##

CVE-2023-7028
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 3.35%

15 posts

An issue has been discovered in GitLab CE/EE affecting all versions from 16.1 prior to 16.1.6, 16.2 prior to 16.2.9, 16.3 prior to 16.3.7, 16.4 prior to 16.4.5, 16.5 prior to 16.5.6, 16.6 prior to 16.6.4, and 16.7 prior to 16.7.2 in which user account password reset emails could be delivered to an unverified email address.

7 repos

https://github.com/Vozec/CVE-2023-7028

https://github.com/RandomRobbieBF/CVE-2023-7028

https://github.com/Esonhugh/gitlab_honeypot

https://github.com/V1lu0/CVE-2023-7028

https://github.com/TheRedDevil1/CVE-2023-7028

https://github.com/duy-31/CVE-2023-7028

https://github.com/yoryio/CVE-2023-7028

zundan@mastodon.zunda.ninja at 2024-01-17T01:09:27.000Z ##

そういえばGitLabは更新した方がいいみたい

GitLabのパスワードリセット機能における脆弱性（CVE-2023-7028）について
最終更新: 2024-01-16
https://www.jpcert.or.jp/newsflash/2024011601.html

##
h12o@mastodon.tokyo at 2024-01-16T15:01:29.000Z ##

>>
修正された脆弱性の内、パスワードリセット機能における脆弱性（CVE-2023-7028）が悪用された場合、任意のユーザーアカウントのパスワードが第三者によりリセットされ、多要素認証を有効にしていない環境ではアカウントの乗っ取りに繋がる可能性があります。なお、同脆弱性の実証コード（PoC）と見られる情報が既に公開されています。

影響を受けるバージョンを利用している場合は、GitLabが提供する情報を参考に、対策や調査を実施いただくことを推奨します。脆弱性を悪用する攻撃の被害を受けた可能性があるかどうかログを調査する方法がGitLabから公開されています。
<<
https://www.jpcert.or.jp/newsflash/2024011601.html

基本的にはまず自分だけでもいいので多要素認証をとにかく有効にしたうえで、作業時間を早めにとってGithubのバージョンアップをすることかな、と思った。

##
snafu@digitalcourage.social at 2024-01-15T22:40:45.000Z ##

So, in case anyone still thinks that patching and security in general is not so important nowadays: Found already several tries of exploiting the recent critical CVE-2023-7028 vulnerability in the logs of my GitLab instance although it was only published a few days ago.

Conclusion:
✅ Install security updates *literally* ASAP.
✅ Turn on mandatory 2FA for all users.

#GitLab #CVE #2FA #Security #Hacker #Update

##
raptor at 2024-01-13T16:13:18.454Z ##

#PoC for #gitlab CVE-2023-7028

https://github.com/Vozec/CVE-2023-7028

Simple payload:
user[email][]=my.target@example.com&user[email][]=hacker@evil.com

🤦 🤦‍♀️ 🤦‍♂️

##
h4sh at 2024-01-13T08:47:34.896Z ##

#GitLab #cve unauthenticated password reset account takeover (CVSS 10.0) CVE-2023-7028

Very simple to exploit, attacker can receive the password reset email for any known user with any email address.

PoC is public and available. Please patch ASAP. You are not affected if you've enforced MFA for all users (as they will be able to reset password but can't login).

#Nuclei template here waiting to merge: https://github.com/projectdiscovery/nuclei-templates/pull/8934

##
harrysintonen at 2024-01-12T19:39:40.436Z ##

The #GitLab #vulnerability allowing trivial account hijacking (CVE-2023-7028) will lead to ton of problems: It will allow malicious actors to perform #supplychain #attacks - something that will allow attacker to gain access to 3rd party who don't themselves run GitLab but just include from projects that do. I would suggest great caution regardless if you run GitLab yourself or not.

Naturally anyone using GitLab themselves must update as soon as possible. I would also suggest performing forensic investigation to find out if you have already been compromised, and take further action in case compromise has already occurred. Check "Were any accounts actually compromised due to this vulnerability?" section in this post for details: https://about.gitlab.com/releases/2024/01/11/critical-security-release-gitlab-16-7-2-released/

##
zeljkazorz at 2024-01-12T11:11:25.546Z ##

A critical vulnerability in GitLab CE/EE (CVE-2023-7028) can be easily exploited by attackers to reset GitLab user account passwords.

https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2024/01/12/cve-2023-7028/

#GitLab #DevOps #SecurityUpdate #Cybersecurity

##
jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-01-12T11:10:05.000Z ##

Critical GitLab flaw allows account takeover without user interaction, patch quickly! (CVE-2023-7028) https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2024/01/12/cve-2023-7028/ #accounthijacking #securityupdate #vulnerability #Don'tmiss #Hotstuff #GitLab #News

##
jomo@mstdn.io at 2024-01-12T00:15:03.000Z ##

PSA: Update your GitLab instances to version 16.7.2, 16.6.4, or 16.5.6!

Critical (CVSS 10/10) vulnerability allows account takeover without user interaction via password reset. CVE-2023-7028

There are some other critical/high vulns as well:

https://about.gitlab.com/releases/2024/01/11/critical-security-release-gitlab-16-7-2-released/#account-takeover-via-password-reset-without-user-interactions

#gitlab #infosec #security #CVE_2023_7028

##
snafu@digitalcourage.social at 2024-01-15T22:40:45.000Z ##

Conclusion:
✅ Install security updates *literally* ASAP.
✅ Turn on mandatory 2FA for all users.

#GitLab #CVE #2FA #Security #Hacker #Update

##
h4sh@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-13T08:47:34.000Z ##

#GitLab #cve unauthenticated password reset account takeover (CVSS 10.0) CVE-2023-7028

Very simple to exploit, attacker can receive the password reset email for any known user with any email address.

PoC is public and available. Please patch ASAP. You are not affected if you've enforced MFA for all users (as they will be able to reset password but can't login).

#Nuclei template here waiting to merge: https://github.com/projectdiscovery/nuclei-templates/pull/8934

##
harrysintonen@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-12T19:39:40.000Z ##

The #GitLab #vulnerability allowing trivial account hijacking (CVE-2023-7028) will lead to ton of problems: It will allow malicious actors to perform #supplychain #attacks - something that will allow attacker to gain access to 3rd party who don't themselves run GitLab but just include from projects that do. I would suggest great caution regardless if you run GitLab yourself or not.

Naturally anyone using GitLab themselves must update as soon as possible. I would also suggest performing forensic investigation to find out if you have already been compromised, and take further action in case compromise has already occurred. Check "Were any accounts actually compromised due to this vulnerability?" section in this post for details: https://about.gitlab.com/releases/2024/01/11/critical-security-release-gitlab-16-7-2-released/

##
zeljkazorz@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-12T11:11:25.000Z ##

A critical vulnerability in GitLab CE/EE (CVE-2023-7028) can be easily exploited by attackers to reset GitLab user account passwords.

https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2024/01/12/cve-2023-7028/

#GitLab #DevOps #SecurityUpdate #Cybersecurity

##
jomo@mstdn.io at 2024-01-12T00:15:03.000Z ##

PSA: Update your GitLab instances to version 16.7.2, 16.6.4, or 16.5.6!

Critical (CVSS 10/10) vulnerability allows account takeover without user interaction via password reset. CVE-2023-7028

There are some other critical/high vulns as well:

https://about.gitlab.com/releases/2024/01/11/critical-security-release-gitlab-16-7-2-released/#account-takeover-via-password-reset-without-user-interactions

#gitlab #infosec #security #CVE_2023_7028

##

CVE-2018-10088
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 2.61%

4 posts

Buffer overflow in XiongMai uc-httpd 1.0.0 has unspecified impact and attack vectors, a different vulnerability than CVE-2017-16725.

simontsui at 2024-01-18T15:13:57.426Z ##

VulnCheck wrote about 7777-Botnet with the following information:

  • 7777-Botnet remains active, and VulnCheck used co-located services to theorize the botnet is infecting TP-Link, Xiongmai, and Hikvision devices using CVE-2017-7577, CVE-2018-10088, CVE-2022-45460, CVE-2021-36260, and/or CVE-2022-24355.
  • The botnet also appears to infect other systems like MVPower, Zyxel NAS, and GitLab, although at a very low volume.
  • The botnet doesn’t just start a service on port 7777. It also spins up a SOCKS5 server on port 11228.

🔗 https://vulncheck.com/blog/ip-intel-7777-botnet

#7777Botnet #botnet #TPLink #Xiongmai #Hikvision #CVE202177577 #CVE201810088 #CVE202245460 #CVE202136260 #CVE202224355 #MVPower #Zyxel #GitLab

  • The botnet doesn’t just start a service on port 7777. It also spins up a SOCKS5 server on port 11228.

hrbrmstr@mastodon.social at 2024-01-10T13:51:17.000Z ##

Old vulns/exploits *never* die.

Yesterday, ace @greynoise Detection Engineer @h0wdy knocked out a 🏷️ for a circa *1999* CVE (CVE-1999-0800 — https://viz.greynoise.io/tag/allaire-forums-cve-1999-0800-attempt?days=30) based on traffic identified in our AI-driven Sift threat hunting platform (https://sift.labs.greynoise.io/?rpt=2023-11-24_report.json.gz&uuid=278790398853d62a9b43e4d780fb8a102ab0af3c50d75b4546849c87b6f13e14).

That traffic is aged out of our 30-day Visualizer window, but I'm sure we'll see it again.

##

CVE-2017-2619
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 1.66%

2 posts

Samba before versions 4.6.1, 4.5.7 and 4.4.11 are vulnerable to a malicious client using a symlink race to allow access to areas of the server file system not exported under the share definition.

jokeyrhyme@aus.social at 2024-01-10T23:31:22.000Z ##

@nzakas true

And it's still possible to have such TOCTOU races lurking elsewhere in a filesystem API, so it's probably not specific to predicates: https://blog.rust-lang.org/2022/01/20/cve-2022-21658.html

And races pop up in any software that has to perform filesystem operations:
- https://www.samba.org/samba/security/CVE-2017-2619.html
- https://www.samba.org/samba/security/CVE-2021-20316.html
- https://www.samba.org/samba/security/CVE-2021-43566.html

Software is hard :)

##
jokeyrhyme@aus.social at 2024-01-10T23:31:22.000Z ##

##

CVE-2023-36025
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.69%

11 posts

Windows SmartScreen Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability

3 repos

https://github.com/coolman6942o/-EXPLOIT-CVE-2023-36025

https://github.com/ka7ana/CVE-2023-36025

https://github.com/J466Y/test_CVE-2023-36025

H3liumb0y at 2024-01-16T08:19:52.398Z ##

"⚠️ CVE-2023-36025: A Stepping Stone in Phemedrone Stealer Attacks"

Trend Micro's recent investigation reveals the exploitation of CVE-2023-36025, a Windows Defender SmartScreen bypass, in the Phemedrone Stealer campaign. This vulnerability allows attackers to evade defense by using .url files to download malicious .cpl scripts unnoticed. Phemedrone Stealer, an open-source malware maintained on GitHub and Telegram, targets web browsers, cryptocurrency wallets, and messaging apps like Telegram and Steam, harvesting sensitive data and system information. Notably, CVE-2023-36025 was patched by Microsoft in Nov 2023, but remains on CISA's Known Exploited Vulnerabilities list due to its active exploitation.

The attack involves hosting malicious Internet Shortcut files on platforms like Discord, often disguised using URL shorteners. Upon execution, these files download a .cpl file, bypassing the usual security prompts. This leverages the MITRE ATT&CK technique T1218.002, using control.exe to run .cpl files. The subsequent stages involve a PowerShell loader hosted on GitHub, and a second-stage loader known as Donut, which executes the final payload in memory. This sophisticated attack sequence showcases the complexity and stealth of modern cyber threats.

Phemedrone's payload is versatile, targeting various applications for sensitive information like passwords, files, and system data. It uses advanced techniques for data handling and compression, highlighting the need for vigilant cybersecurity practices.

Tags: #CyberSecurity #CVE202336025 #PhemedroneStealer #DefenseEvasion #Malware #TrendMicro #MicrosoftSecurity #CISA #MITREATTACK #DonutLoader

MITRE ATT&CK - T1218.002

Source: https://www.trendmicro.com/en_us/research/24/a/cve-2023-36025-exploited-for-defense-evasion-in-phemedrone-steal.html

##
H3liumb0y@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-16T08:19:52.000Z ##

"⚠️ CVE-2023-36025: A Stepping Stone in Phemedrone Stealer Attacks"

Trend Micro's recent investigation reveals the exploitation of CVE-2023-36025, a Windows Defender SmartScreen bypass, in the Phemedrone Stealer campaign. This vulnerability allows attackers to evade defense by using .url files to download malicious .cpl scripts unnoticed. Phemedrone Stealer, an open-source malware maintained on GitHub and Telegram, targets web browsers, cryptocurrency wallets, and messaging apps like Telegram and Steam, harvesting sensitive data and system information. Notably, CVE-2023-36025 was patched by Microsoft in Nov 2023, but remains on CISA's Known Exploited Vulnerabilities list due to its active exploitation.

The attack involves hosting malicious Internet Shortcut files on platforms like Discord, often disguised using URL shorteners. Upon execution, these files download a .cpl file, bypassing the usual security prompts. This leverages the MITRE ATT&CK technique T1218.002, using control.exe to run .cpl files. The subsequent stages involve a PowerShell loader hosted on GitHub, and a second-stage loader known as Donut, which executes the final payload in memory. This sophisticated attack sequence showcases the complexity and stealth of modern cyber threats.

Phemedrone's payload is versatile, targeting various applications for sensitive information like passwords, files, and system data. It uses advanced techniques for data handling and compression, highlighting the need for vigilant cybersecurity practices.

Tags: #CyberSecurity #CVE202336025 #PhemedroneStealer #DefenseEvasion #Malware #TrendMicro #MicrosoftSecurity #CISA #MITREATTACK #DonutLoader

Source: https://www.trendmicro.com/en_us/research/24/a/cve-2023-36025-exploited-for-defense-evasion-in-phemedrone-steal.html

##
avoidthehack at 2024-01-17T19:06:17.059Z ##

Hackers Weaponize #Windows Flaw to Deploy Crypto-Siphoning Phemedrone Stealer

Note: This vulnerability (CVE-2023-36025) is now patched as of NOV 2023. So hopefully you've updated your Windows device(s) since November 2023 Patch Tuesday.

Also, this campaign is yet another that abuses Discord's CDN by hosting the malware. The #malware executes a control panel file in a way that bypasses #Defender SmartScreen. Paves the way for loading information stealer "Phemedrone"

#cybersecurity #infosec #security

https://thehackernews.com/2024/01/hackers-weaponize-windows-flaw-to.html

##
oversecurity@mastodon.social at 2024-01-15T18:50:06.000Z ##

Windows SmartScreen flaw exploited to drop Phemedrone malware

A Phemedrone information-stealing malware campaign exploits a Microsoft Defender SmartScreen vulnerability (CVE-2023-36025) to bypass Windows...

🔗️ [Bleepingcomputer] https://link.is.it/ijastn

##
jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-01-15T13:50:04.000Z ##

Windows SmartScreen bug exploited to deliver powerful info-stealer (CVE-2023-36025) https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2024/01/15/cve-2023-36025-exploited/ #TrendMicro #Don'tmiss #Hotstuff #malware #Windows #News

##
VirusBulletin at 2024-01-15T09:22:31.061Z ##

Trend Micro's Peter Girnus, Aliakbar Zahravi & Simon Zuckerbraun delve into the Phemedrone Stealer campaign's exploitation of CVE-2023-36025, the Windows Defender SmartScreen Bypass vulnerability, for its defense evasion, & investigate the malware's payload. https://www.trendmicro.com/en_us/research/24/a/cve-2023-36025-exploited-for-defense-evasion-in-phemedrone-steal.html

##
simontsui at 2024-01-12T14:20:34.887Z ##

Trend Micro uncovered evidence pointing to an active exploitation of CVE-2023-36025 (8.8 high, exploited as a zero-day with public disclosure, disclosed by Microsoft in 14 November 2023 Patch Tuesday) to infect users with a previously unknown strain of the malware, Phemedrone Stealer. Phemedrone targets web browsers and data from cryptocurrency wallets and messaging apps such as Telegram, Steam, and Discord. It also takes screenshots and gathers system information regarding hardware, location, and operating system details. The stolen data is then sent to the attackers via Telegram or their C2 server. This open-source stealer is written in C# and actively maintained on GitHub and Telegram. TTPs and payload analysis described. IOC provided.
🔗 https://www.trendmicro.com/en_us/research/24/a/cve-2023-36025-exploited-for-defense-evasion-in-phemedrone-steal.html

##
avoidthehack@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-17T19:06:17.000Z ##

Hackers Weaponize #Windows Flaw to Deploy Crypto-Siphoning Phemedrone Stealer

Note: This vulnerability (CVE-2023-36025) is now patched as of NOV 2023. So hopefully you've updated your Windows device(s) since November 2023 Patch Tuesday.

Also, this campaign is yet another that abuses Discord's CDN by hosting the malware. The #malware executes a control panel file in a way that bypasses #Defender SmartScreen. Paves the way for loading information stealer "Phemedrone"

#cybersecurity #infosec #security

https://thehackernews.com/2024/01/hackers-weaponize-windows-flaw-to.html

simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-12T14:20:34.000Z ##

Trend Micro uncovered evidence pointing to an active exploitation of CVE-2023-36025 (8.8 high, exploited as a zero-day with public disclosure, disclosed by Microsoft in 14 November 2023 Patch Tuesday) to infect users with a previously unknown strain of the malware, Phemedrone Stealer. Phemedrone targets web browsers and data from cryptocurrency wallets and messaging apps such as Telegram, Steam, and Discord. It also takes screenshots and gathers system information regarding hardware, location, and operating system details. The stolen data is then sent to the attackers via Telegram or their C2 server. This open-source stealer is written in C# and actively maintained on GitHub and Telegram. TTPs and payload analysis described. IOC provided.
🔗 https://www.trendmicro.com/en_us/research/24/a/cve-2023-36025-exploited-for-defense-evasion-in-phemedrone-steal.html

##

CVE-2016-20017
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.69%

2 posts

D-Link DSL-2750B devices before 1.05 allow remote unauthenticated command injection via the login.cgi cli parameter, as exploited in the wild in 2016 through 2022.

simontsui at 2024-01-08T16:19:10.832Z ##

CISA Adds Six Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog:

  • CVE-2023-38203 Adobe ColdFusion Deserialization of Untrusted Data Vulnerability
  • CVE-2023-29300 Adobe ColdFusion Deserialization of Untrusted Data Vulnerability
  • CVE-2023-27524 Apache Superset Insecure Default Initialization of Resource Vulnerability
  • CVE-2023-41990 Apple Multiple Products Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2016-20017 D-Link DSL-2750B Devices Command Injection Vulnerability
  • CVE-2023-23752 Joomla! Improper Access Control Vulnerability

🔗 https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/01/08/cisa-adds-six-known-exploited-vulnerabilities-catalog

simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-08T16:19:10.000Z ##

##

CVE-2024-21650
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.58%

4 posts

### Impact XWiki is vulnerable to a remote code execution (RCE) attack through its user registration feature. This issue allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code by crafting malicious payloads in the "first name" or "last name" fields during user registration. This impacts all installations that have user registration enabled for guests. To reproduce, register with any username and password a

decio at 2024-01-10T08:29:31.677Z ##

Si vous avez un XWiki exposé sur Internet avec le module d'inscription des utilisateurs activé, il est important de réagir vite à la vulnérabilité CVE-2024-21650.

Cette faille permet l'exécution de code à distance par des attaquants.

🔒 Action recommandée : Mettez à jour votre XWiki rapidement vers les versions 14.10.17, 15.5.3 et successives…

Réf.
https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/security/advisories/GHSA-rj7p-xjv7-7229

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-21650

#CyberVeille #xwiki

##
h4sh at 2024-01-10T03:21:35.376Z ##

For anyone using #XWiki - please quickly patch CVE-2024-21650 (Unauthenticated Remote Code Execution via registration forms).

You can also disable registration, but unsure if this will completely mitigate the vulnerability.

CVE-2022-1471
(8.3 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.58%

2 posts

### Summary SnakeYaml's `Constructor` class, which inherits from `SafeConstructor`, allows any type be deserialized given the following line: new Yaml(new Constructor(TestDataClass.class)).load(yamlContent); Types do not have to match the types of properties in the target class. A `ConstructorException` is thrown, but only after a malicious payload is deserialized. ### Severity High, lack of ty

##

CVE-2017-7577
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.50%

2 posts

XiongMai uc-httpd has directory traversal allowing the reading of arbitrary files via a "GET ../" HTTP request.

simontsui at 2024-01-18T15:13:57.426Z ##

VulnCheck wrote about 7777-Botnet with the following information:

  • 7777-Botnet remains active, and VulnCheck used co-located services to theorize the botnet is infecting TP-Link, Xiongmai, and Hikvision devices using CVE-2017-7577, CVE-2018-10088, CVE-2022-45460, CVE-2021-36260, and/or CVE-2022-24355.
  • The botnet also appears to infect other systems like MVPower, Zyxel NAS, and GitLab, although at a very low volume.
  • The botnet doesn’t just start a service on port 7777. It also spins up a SOCKS5 server on port 11228.

🔗 https://vulncheck.com/blog/ip-intel-7777-botnet

#7777Botnet #botnet #TPLink #Xiongmai #Hikvision #CVE202177577 #CVE201810088 #CVE202245460 #CVE202136260 #CVE202224355 #MVPower #Zyxel #GitLab

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-18T15:13:57.000Z ##

VulnCheck wrote about 7777-Botnet with the following information:

  • 7777-Botnet remains active, and VulnCheck used co-located services to theorize the botnet is infecting TP-Link, Xiongmai, and Hikvision devices using CVE-2017-7577, CVE-2018-10088, CVE-2022-45460, CVE-2021-36260, and/or CVE-2022-24355.
  • The botnet also appears to infect other systems like MVPower, Zyxel NAS, and GitLab, although at a very low volume.
  • The botnet doesn’t just start a service on port 7777. It also spins up a SOCKS5 server on port 11228.

🔗 https://vulncheck.com/blog/ip-intel-7777-botnet

2 posts

simontsui at 2024-01-09T18:44:11.283Z ##

I had too much free time and produced a list of what Microsoft considered "Exploitation More Likely" (their version of Exploit Prediction Scoring System (EPSS)):

  • CVE-2024-20674 (9.0 critical): Windows Kerberos Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-21318 (8.8 high): Microsoft SharePoint Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20683 (7.8 high): Win32k Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20698 (7.8 high): Windows Kernel Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20653 (7.8 high): Microsoft Common Log File System Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20686 (7.8 high): Win32k Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-21310 (7.8 high): Windows Cloud Files Mini Filter Driver Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-21307 (7.5 high): Remote Desktop Client Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20652 (7.5 high): Windows HTML Platforms Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability

Again, not publicly disclosed or exploited.

I had too much free time and produced a list of what Microsoft considered "Exploitation More Likely" (their version of Exploit Prediction Scoring System (EPSS)):

  • CVE-2024-20674 (9.0 critical): Windows Kerberos Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-21318 (8.8 high): Microsoft SharePoint Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20683 (7.8 high): Win32k Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20698 (7.8 high): Windows Kernel Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability

  • CVE-2024-21310 (7.8 high): Windows Cloud Files Mini Filter Driver Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability

CVE-2022-46175
(7.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.40%

2 posts

The `parse` method of the JSON5 library before and including version `2.2.1` does not restrict parsing of keys named `__proto__`, allowing specially crafted strings to pollute the prototype of the resulting object. This vulnerability pollutes the prototype of the object returned by `JSON5.parse` and not the global Object prototype, which is the commonly understood definition of Prototype Pollutio

(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.24%

9 posts

An Out-of-bounds Write vulnerability in J-Web of Juniper Networks Junos OS on SRX Series and EX Series allows an unauthenticated, network-based attacker to cause a Denial of Service (DoS), or Remote Code Execution (RCE) and obtain root privileges on the device. This issue is caused by use of an insecure function allowing an attacker to overwrite arbitrary memory. This issue affects Juniper Netw

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-01-15T09:30:03.000Z ##

Juniper fixes critical RCE in its SRX firewalls and EX switches (CVE-2024-21591) https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2024/01/15/cve-2024-21591/ #JuniperNetworks #securityupdate #vulnerability #enterprise #Don'tmiss #Hotstuff #firewall #News

##
campuscodi@mastodon.social at 2024-01-14T11:13:02.000Z ##

According to Censys, there are more than 11,500 Juniper devices with J-Web enabled on the internet, and possibly exposed to attacks via the new RCE (CVE-2024-21591)

https://censys.com/cve-2024-21591-juniper-j-web-oob-write-vulnerability/

##
jbhall56 at 2024-01-13T15:25:21.884Z ##

Found in the devices' J-Web configuration interfaces and tracked as CVE-2024-21591, this critical security flaw can also be exploited by unauthenticated threat actors to get root privileges or launch denial-of-service (DoS) attacks against unpatched devices. https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/juniper-warns-of-critical-rce-bug-in-its-firewalls-and-switches/#google_vignette

##
simontsui at 2024-01-12T19:24:13.210Z ##

Juniper security advisory: Junos OS: SRX Series and EX Series: CVE-2024-21591 (9.8 critical, disclosed 10 January 2024) preAuth Remote Code Execution vulnerability in J-web
"An Out-of-bounds Write vulnerability in J-Web of Juniper Networks Junos OS SRX Series and EX Series allows an unauthenticated, network-based attacker to cause a Denial of Service (DoS), or Remote Code Execution (RCE) and obtain root privileges on the device. This issue is caused by use of an insecure function allowing an attacker to overwrite arbitrary memory. Juniper SIRT is not aware of any malicious exploitation of this vulnerability."
🔗 https://supportportal.juniper.net/s/article/2024-01-Security-Bulletin-Junos-OS-SRX-Series-and-EX-Series-Security-Vulnerability-in-J-web-allows-a-preAuth-Remote-Code-Execution-CVE-2024-21591?language=en_US

CVE-2024-0057

EPSS: 0.23%

  • CVE-2024-20674 (9.0 critical): Windows Kerberos Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability

##

CVE-2022-45460
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.21%

4 posts

Multiple Xiongmai NVR devices, including MBD6304T V4.02.R11.00000117.10001.131900.00000 and NBD6808T-PL V4.02.R11.C7431119.12001.130000.00000, allow an unauthenticated and remote user to exploit a stack-based buffer overflow and crash the web server, resulting in a system reboot. An unauthenticated and remote attacker can execute arbitrary code by sending a crafted HTTP request that triggers the o

simontsui at 2024-01-18T15:13:57.426Z ##

VulnCheck wrote about 7777-Botnet with the following information:

  • 7777-Botnet remains active, and VulnCheck used co-located services to theorize the botnet is infecting TP-Link, Xiongmai, and Hikvision devices using CVE-2017-7577, CVE-2018-10088, CVE-2022-45460, CVE-2021-36260, and/or CVE-2022-24355.
  • The botnet also appears to infect other systems like MVPower, Zyxel NAS, and GitLab, although at a very low volume.
  • The botnet doesn’t just start a service on port 7777. It also spins up a SOCKS5 server on port 11228.

🔗 https://vulncheck.com/blog/ip-intel-7777-botnet

#7777Botnet #botnet #TPLink #Xiongmai #Hikvision #CVE202177577 #CVE201810088 #CVE202245460 #CVE202136260 #CVE202224355 #MVPower #Zyxel #GitLab

CVE-2024-20652

EPSS: 0.20%

2 posts

Windows HTML Platforms Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability

simontsui at 2024-01-09T18:44:11.283Z ##

I had too much free time and produced a list of what Microsoft considered "Exploitation More Likely" (their version of Exploit Prediction Scoring System (EPSS)):

  • CVE-2024-20674 (9.0 critical): Windows Kerberos Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-21318 (8.8 high): Microsoft SharePoint Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20683 (7.8 high): Win32k Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20698 (7.8 high): Windows Kernel Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20653 (7.8 high): Microsoft Common Log File System Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20686 (7.8 high): Win32k Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-21310 (7.8 high): Windows Cloud Files Mini Filter Driver Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-21307 (7.5 high): Remote Desktop Client Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20652 (7.5 high): Windows HTML Platforms Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability

Again, not publicly disclosed or exploited.

CVE-2022-35737
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.18%

2 posts

SQLite 1.0.12 through 3.39.x before 3.39.2 sometimes allows an array-bounds overflow if billions of bytes are used in a string argument to a C API.

2 repos

https://github.com/gmh5225/CVE-2022-35737

https://github.com/rvermeulen/codeql-cve-2022-35737

simontsui at 2024-01-09T18:20:27.091Z ##

Microsoft included a third party introduced vulnerability CVE-2022-35737 (CVSSv3: 7.5 high severity, disclosed 25 July 2022) from MITRE on behalf of SQLite: SQLite 1.0.12 through 3.39.x before 3.39.2 sometimes allows an array-bounds overflow if billions of bytes are used in a string argument to a C API. Not publicly disclosed or exploited.
🔗 https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2022-35737

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-09T18:20:27.000Z ##

Microsoft included a third party introduced vulnerability CVE-2022-35737 (CVSSv3: 7.5 high severity, disclosed 25 July 2022) from MITRE on behalf of SQLite: SQLite 1.0.12 through 3.39.x before 3.39.2 sometimes allows an array-bounds overflow if billions of bytes are used in a string argument to a C API. Not publicly disclosed or exploited.
🔗 https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2022-35737

##

CVE-2021-20316
(6.8 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.18%

2 posts

A flaw was found in the way Samba handled file/directory metadata. This flaw allows an authenticated attacker with permissions to read or modify share metadata, to perform this operation outside of the share.

jokeyrhyme@aus.social at 2024-01-10T23:31:22.000Z ##

@nzakas true

And it's still possible to have such TOCTOU races lurking elsewhere in a filesystem API, so it's probably not specific to predicates: https://blog.rust-lang.org/2022/01/20/cve-2022-21658.html

And races pop up in any software that has to perform filesystem operations:
- https://www.samba.org/samba/security/CVE-2017-2619.html
- https://www.samba.org/samba/security/CVE-2021-20316.html
- https://www.samba.org/samba/security/CVE-2021-43566.html

Software is hard :)

##
jokeyrhyme@aus.social at 2024-01-10T23:31:22.000Z ##

@nzakas true

And it's still possible to have such TOCTOU races lurking elsewhere in a filesystem API, so it's probably not specific to predicates: https://blog.rust-lang.org/2022/01/20/cve-2022-21658.html

And races pop up in any software that has to perform filesystem operations:
- https://www.samba.org/samba/security/CVE-2017-2619.html
- https://www.samba.org/samba/security/CVE-2021-20316.html
- https://www.samba.org/samba/security/CVE-2021-43566.html

Software is hard :)

##

CVE-2023-34048
(9.8 UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.17%

13 posts

vCenter Server contains an out-of-bounds write vulnerability in the implementation of the DCERPC protocol. A malicious actor with network access to vCenter Server may trigger an out-of-bounds write potentially leading to remote code execution.

simontsui at 2024-01-19T17:33:52.738Z ##

UNC3886 is a Chinese state-sponsored cyberespionage group that has targeted and exploited zero-day vulnerabilities in firewall and virtualization technologies, which do not support EDR solutions. UNC3886 has primarily targeted defense, technology, and telecommunication organizations located in the US and APJ regions. First public reporting on UNC3886 exploitation came from Mandiant on 29 September 2022.

UNC886 has been known to leverage the following vulnerabilities:

  • CVE-2022-41328 (7.1 high, disclosed 07 March 2023, in KEV) Fortinet FortiOS local directory traversal leads to arbitrary read/write
  • CVE-2023-20867 (3.9 low, disclosed 13 June 2023 by VMware, in KEV, VMware Tools Authentication Bypass)
  • CVE-2023-34048 (9.8 critical, disclosed 25 Octover 2023, under active exploitation, VMware vCenter Server Out-of-Bounds Write Vulnerability to RCE)

#UNC3886 #CVE202241328 #CVE202320867 #CVE202334048 #VMware #vCenter #RCE #FortiOS #KEV #China #cyberespionage #VMwaretools #APT

##
simontsui at 2024-01-19T16:37:43.513Z ##

HOT OFF THE PRESS: Mandiant reports that Chinese Espionage Group UNC3886 was found exploiting VMware vCenter RCE vulnerability CVE-2023-34048 as a Zero-Day since late 2021!
🔗 https://www.mandiant.com/resources/blog/chinese-vmware-exploitation-since-2021

#Mandiant #UNC3886 #VMware #vCenter #CVE202334048 #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation

##
simontsui at 2024-01-19T16:01:42.929Z ##

Rapid7 warns of both VMware RCE vulnerability CVE-2023-34048 (9.8 critical, disclosed 25 Octover 2023, under active exploitation) and Atlassian Confluence RCE vulnerability CVE-2023-22527 (10.0 critical, disclosed 16 January 2024).
🔗 https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2024/01/19/etr-critical-cves-in-outdated-versions-of-atlassian-confluence-and-vmware-vcenter-server/

#Atlassian #Confluence #RCE #vulnerability #activeexploitation #eitw #CVE202334048 #CVE202322527

##
simontsui at 2024-01-19T14:29:42.822Z ##

VMware updated their advisory for CVE-2023-34048 (9.8 critical, disclosed 25 October 2023, VMware vCenter Server Out-of-Bounds Write Vulnerability, allows RCE) "VMware has confirmed that exploitation of CVE-2023-34048 has occurred in the wild."
🔗 https://www.vmware.com/security/advisories/VMSA-2023-0023.html

#eitw #VMware #vCenter #RCE #vulnerability #CVE202334048 #activeexploitation

Chinese hackers exploit VMware bug as zero-day for two years

A Chinese hacking group has been exploiting a critical vCenter Server vulnerability (CVE-2023-34048) as a zero-day since at least late 2021.

🔗️ [Bleepingcomputer] https://link.is.it/o1koof

CVE-2023-20867
(3.9 UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.16%

4 posts

A fully compromised ESXi host can force VMware Tools to fail to authenticate host-to-guest operations, impacting the confidentiality and integrity of the guest virtual machine.

simontsui at 2024-01-19T17:33:52.738Z ##

UNC3886 is a Chinese state-sponsored cyberespionage group that has targeted and exploited zero-day vulnerabilities in firewall and virtualization technologies, which do not support EDR solutions. UNC3886 has primarily targeted defense, technology, and telecommunication organizations located in the US and APJ regions. First public reporting on UNC3886 exploitation came from Mandiant on 29 September 2022.

UNC886 has been known to leverage the following vulnerabilities:

  • CVE-2022-41328 (7.1 high, disclosed 07 March 2023, in KEV) Fortinet FortiOS local directory traversal leads to arbitrary read/write
  • CVE-2023-20867 (3.9 low, disclosed 13 June 2023 by VMware, in KEV, VMware Tools Authentication Bypass)
  • CVE-2023-34048 (9.8 critical, disclosed 25 Octover 2023, under active exploitation, VMware vCenter Server Out-of-Bounds Write Vulnerability to RCE)

#UNC3886 #CVE202241328 #CVE202320867 #CVE202334048 #VMware #vCenter #RCE #FortiOS #KEV #China #cyberespionage #VMwaretools #APT

CVE-2023-6927
(4.6 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.12%

2 posts

A flaw was found in Keycloak. This issue may allow an attacker to steal authorization codes or tokens from clients using a wildcard in the JARM response mode "form_post.jwt" which could be used to bypass the security patch implemented to address CVE-2023-6134.

techbrunchfr at 2024-01-12T15:16:25.818Z ##

Writeup: Keycloak open redirect (CVE-2023-6927) - https://securityblog.omegapoint.se/en/writeup-keycloak-cve-2023-6027/ #keycloak

##
techbrunchfr@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-12T15:16:25.000Z ##

Writeup: Keycloak open redirect (CVE-2023-6927) - https://securityblog.omegapoint.se/en/writeup-keycloak-cve-2023-6027/ #keycloak

##

CVE-2023-0656
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.11%

2 posts

A Stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability in the SonicOS allows a remote unauthenticated attacker to cause Denial of Service (DoS), which could cause an impacted firewall to crash.

1 repos

https://github.com/BishopFox/CVE-2022-22274_CVE-2023-0656

jbhall56 at 2024-01-16T13:35:58.631Z ##

These appliances are affected by two DoS security flaws tracked as CVE-2022-22274 and CVE-2023-0656, the former also allowing attackers to gain remote code execution. https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/over-178k-sonicwall-firewalls-vulnerable-to-dos-potential-rce-attacks

##
jbhall56@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-16T13:35:58.000Z ##

These appliances are affected by two DoS security flaws tracked as CVE-2022-22274 and CVE-2023-0656, the former also allowing attackers to gain remote code execution. https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/over-178k-sonicwall-firewalls-vulnerable-to-dos-potential-rce-attacks

##

CVE-2022-37599
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.11%

2 posts

A regular expression denial of service (ReDoS) flaw was found in Function interpolateName in interpolateName.js in webpack loader-utils via the resourcePath variable in interpolateName.js. A badly or maliciously formed string could be used to send crafted requests that cause a system to crash or take a disproportional amount of time to process. This issue has been patched in versions 1.4.2, 2.0.4

##

CVE-2023-37450
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.11%

2 posts

The issue was addressed with improved checks. This issue is fixed in watchOS 9.6, iOS 16.6 and iPadOS 16.6, Safari 16.5.2, macOS Ventura 13.5, tvOS 16.6. Processing web content may lead to arbitrary code execution. Apple is aware of a report that this issue may have been actively exploited.

simontsui at 2024-01-09T02:39:24.206Z ##

Honestly, I'm surprised that CVE-2023-38203 was added to CISA's KEV Catalog 6 months later. @catc0n of Rapid7 alerted the community to zero-day exploitation using Project Discovery's CVE-2023-38203 technical details and proof of concept exploit around 17 July: https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2023/07/17/etr-active-exploitation-of-multiple-adobe-coldfusion-vulnerabilities/

Then again, that was a wild week/month. Patch Tuesday had Microsoft disclosing 6 actively exploited zero-days; Apple had the WebKit zero-day CVE-2023-37450. This was followed the next week with Citrix CVE-2023-3519, and Ivanti EPMM CVE-2023-35078. #CveCrowdDeny

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-09T02:39:24.000Z ##

Honestly, I'm surprised that CVE-2023-38203 was added to CISA's KEV Catalog 6 months later. @catc0n of Rapid7 alerted the community to zero-day exploitation using Project Discovery's CVE-2023-38203 technical details and proof of concept exploit around 17 July: https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2023/07/17/etr-active-exploitation-of-multiple-adobe-coldfusion-vulnerabilities/

Then again, that was a wild week/month. Patch Tuesday had Microsoft disclosing 6 actively exploited zero-days; Apple had the WebKit zero-day CVE-2023-37450. This was followed the next week with Citrix CVE-2023-3519, and Ivanti EPMM CVE-2023-35078. #CveCrowdDeny

##

CVE-2023-32695
(7.3 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.11%

2 posts

### Impact A specially crafted Socket.IO packet can trigger an uncaught exception on the Socket.IO server, thus killing the Node.js process. ``` TypeError: Cannot convert object to primitive value at Socket.emit (node:events:507:25) at .../node_modules/socket.io/lib/socket.js:531:14 ``` ### Patches A fix has been released today (2023/05/22): - https://github.com/socketio/socket.

##

CVE-2024-20675
(6.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.11%

2 posts

Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability

simontsui at 2024-01-11T21:27:53.462Z ##

Microsoft MSRC updated with five* security advisories related to Chromium. The unexpected part was all the additional information:

  • CVE-2024-20709 Adobe Systems Incorporated: CVE-2024-20709 Javascript Implementation PDF Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20675 (6.3 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2023-48631Adobe Systems Incorporated: CVE-2023-Improper Input Validation Denial of Service Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-0333 Chromium: CVE-2024-0333 Insufficient data validation in Extensions
  • CVE-2024-21337 (5.2 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability

CVE-2024-20709, CVE-2024-20675, CVE-2023-48631, CVE-2024-21337 are marked Not Publicly Disclosed, Not Exploited, and Exploitation Less Likely. CVE-2024-21337 was published 30 minutes later.

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-11T21:27:53.000Z ##

Microsoft MSRC updated with five* security advisories related to Chromium. The unexpected part was all the additional information:

  • CVE-2024-20709 Adobe Systems Incorporated: CVE-2024-20709 Javascript Implementation PDF Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20675 (6.3 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2023-48631Adobe Systems Incorporated: CVE-2023-Improper Input Validation Denial of Service Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-0333 Chromium: CVE-2024-0333 Insufficient data validation in Extensions
  • CVE-2024-21337 (5.2 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability

CVE-2024-20709, CVE-2024-20675, CVE-2023-48631, CVE-2024-21337 are marked Not Publicly Disclosed, Not Exploited, and Exploitation Less Likely. CVE-2024-21337 was published 30 minutes later.

##

CVE-2022-44729
(7.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.10%

1 posts

Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) vulnerability in Apache Software Foundation Apache XML Graphics Batik.This issue affects Apache XML Graphics Batik: 1.16. On version 1.16, a malicious SVG could trigger loading external resources by default, causing resource consumption or in some cases even information disclosure. Users are recommended to upgrade to version 1.17 or later.

psytester at 2024-01-18T17:10:24.383Z ##

I published my simple PoC for CVE-2022-44729 Atlassian Jira SSRF due to Apache Batik vulnerabilites.

https://psytester.github.io/Jira_SSRF_at_Batik_CVEs_PoC/

##

CVE-2021-43566
(2.5 LOW)

EPSS: 0.09%

2 posts

All versions of Samba prior to 4.13.16 are vulnerable to a malicious client using an SMB1 or NFS race to allow a directory to be created in an area of the server file system not exported under the share definition. Note that SMB1 has to be enabled, or the share also available via NFS in order for this attack to succeed.

jokeyrhyme@aus.social at 2024-01-10T23:31:22.000Z ##

@nzakas true

And it's still possible to have such TOCTOU races lurking elsewhere in a filesystem API, so it's probably not specific to predicates: https://blog.rust-lang.org/2022/01/20/cve-2022-21658.html

And races pop up in any software that has to perform filesystem operations:
- https://www.samba.org/samba/security/CVE-2017-2619.html
- https://www.samba.org/samba/security/CVE-2021-20316.html
- https://www.samba.org/samba/security/CVE-2021-43566.html

Software is hard :)

##
jokeyrhyme@aus.social at 2024-01-10T23:31:22.000Z ##

@nzakas true

And it's still possible to have such TOCTOU races lurking elsewhere in a filesystem API, so it's probably not specific to predicates: https://blog.rust-lang.org/2022/01/20/cve-2022-21658.html

And races pop up in any software that has to perform filesystem operations:
- https://www.samba.org/samba/security/CVE-2017-2619.html
- https://www.samba.org/samba/security/CVE-2021-20316.html
- https://www.samba.org/samba/security/CVE-2021-43566.html

Software is hard :)

CVE-2022-24355(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.09%

4 posts

This vulnerability allows network-adjacent attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of TP-Link TL-WR940N 3.20.1 Build 200316 Rel.34392n (5553) routers. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability. The specific flaw exists within the parsing of file name extensions. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of the length of user-supplied data prior t

simontsui at 2024-01-18T15:13:57.426Z ##

VulnCheck wrote about 7777-Botnet with the following information:

  • 7777-Botnet remains active, and VulnCheck used co-located services to theorize the botnet is infecting TP-Link, Xiongmai, and Hikvision devices using CVE-2017-7577, CVE-2018-10088, CVE-2022-45460, CVE-2021-36260, and/or CVE-2022-24355.
  • The botnet also appears to infect other systems like MVPower, Zyxel NAS, and GitLab, although at a very low volume.
  • The botnet doesn’t just start a service on port 7777. It also spins up a SOCKS5 server on port 11228.

🔗 https://vulncheck.com/blog/ip-intel-7777-botnet

#7777Botnet #botnet #TPLink #Xiongmai #Hikvision #CVE202177577 #CVE201810088 #CVE202245460 #CVE202136260 #CVE202224355 #MVPower #Zyxel #GitLab

  • The botnet doesn’t just start a service on port 7777. It also spins up a SOCKS5 server on port 11228.

CVE-2022-25883
(5.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.09%

2 posts

Versions of the package semver before 7.5.2 on the 7.x branch, before 6.3.1 on the 6.x branch, and all other versions before 5.7.2 are vulnerable to Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDoS) via the function new Range, when untrusted user data is provided as a range.

##

CVE-2023-29218
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.08%

2 posts

The Twitter Recommendation Algorithm through ec83d01 allows attackers to cause a denial of service (reduction of reputation score) by arranging for multiple Twitter accounts to coordinate negative signals regarding a target account, such as unfollowing, muting, blocking, and reporting, as exploited in the wild in March and April 2023.

simontsui at 2024-01-20T00:22:31.935Z ##

@todb do you remember when Twitter open sourced their algorithm on 31 March 2023, and it ultimately led to the creation of a "denial of service" vulnerability
CVE-2023-29218? https://steventey.com/blog/twitter-algorithm

Fun times. Now when is CVE-2023-29218 getting added to the KEV Catalog for that incident? 😂

EPSS: 0.07%

2 posts

A parsing issue similar to CVE-2022-3171, but with textformat in protobuf-java core and lite versions prior to 3.21.7, 3.20.3, 3.19.6 and 3.16.3 can lead to a denial of service attack. Inputs containing multiple instances of non-repeated embedded messages with repeated or unknown fields causes objects to be converted back-n-forth between mutable and immutable forms, resulting in potentially long g

(7.8 HIGH)

4 posts

The issue was addressed with improved handling of caches. This issue is fixed in macOS Ventura 13.2, iOS 15.7.8 and iPadOS 15.7.8, watchOS 9.3, tvOS 16.3, iOS 16.3 and iPadOS 16.3, macOS Big Sur 11.7.9, macOS Monterey 12.6.8. Processing a font file may lead to arbitrary code execution. Apple is aware of a report that this issue may have been actively exploited against versions of iOS released befo

simontsui at 2024-01-08T16:36:58.969Z ##

@hrbrmstr @greynoise Here's the CISA alert page: https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/01/08/cisa-adds-six-known-exploited-vulnerabilities-catalog

The Apple entry flew under the radar for me because the original security advisory was published 23 January 2023 and was updated? 08 September. CVE-2023-41990: "The issue was addressed with improved handling of caches. This issue is fixed in tvOS 16.3, iOS 16.3 and iPadOS 16.3, macOS Monterey 12.6.8, macOS Big Sur 11.7.9, iOS 15.7.8 and iPadOS 15.7.8, macOS Ventura 13.2, watchOS 9.3. Processing a font file may lead to arbitrary code execution. Apple is aware of a report that this issue may have been actively exploited against versions of iOS released before iOS 15.7.1."

CVE-2022-21658
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.07%

2 posts

N/A

1 repos

https://github.com/sagittarius-a/cve-2022-21658

jokeyrhyme@aus.social at 2024-01-10T23:31:22.000Z ##

@nzakas true

And it's still possible to have such TOCTOU races lurking elsewhere in a filesystem API, so it's probably not specific to predicates: https://blog.rust-lang.org/2022/01/20/cve-2022-21658.html

And races pop up in any software that has to perform filesystem operations:
- https://www.samba.org/samba/security/CVE-2017-2619.html
- https://www.samba.org/samba/security/CVE-2021-20316.html
- https://www.samba.org/samba/security/CVE-2021-43566.html

Software is hard :)

##
jokeyrhyme@aus.social at 2024-01-10T23:31:22.000Z ##

@nzakas true

And it's still possible to have such TOCTOU races lurking elsewhere in a filesystem API, so it's probably not specific to predicates: https://blog.rust-lang.org/2022/01/20/cve-2022-21658.html

And races pop up in any software that has to perform filesystem operations:
- https://www.samba.org/samba/security/CVE-2017-2619.html
- https://www.samba.org/samba/security/CVE-2021-20316.html
- https://www.samba.org/samba/security/CVE-2021-43566.html

simontsui at 2024-01-11T21:27:53.462Z ##

Microsoft MSRC updated with five* security advisories related to Chromium. The unexpected part was all the additional information:

  • CVE-2024-20709 Adobe Systems Incorporated: CVE-2024-20709 Javascript Implementation PDF Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20675 (6.3 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2023-48631Adobe Systems Incorporated: CVE-2023-Improper Input Validation Denial of Service Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-0333 Chromium: CVE-2024-0333 Insufficient data validation in Extensions
  • CVE-2024-21337 (5.2 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability

CVE-2024-20709, CVE-2024-20675, CVE-2023-48631, CVE-2024-21337 are marked Not Publicly Disclosed, Not Exploited, and Exploitation Less Likely. CVE-2024-21337 was published 30 minutes later.

  • CVE-2023-48795 (5.3 medium): OpenSSH Terrapin attack (third party)
  • CVE-2023-37932 (6.2 medium): FortiVoice - Path traversal vulnerability in administrative interface
  • CVE-2023-48783 (4.9 medium): FortiPortal - Insufficient Access Control over API endpoints
  • CVE-2023-46712 (6.3 medium): FortiPortal - Account creation outside initial IdP
  • CVE-2023-37934 (4.2 medium): FortiPAM - Lack of rate control to protect against DoS attacks
  • CVE-2023-44250 (8.8 high): FortiOS & FortiProxy - Improper authorization for HA requests

No mention of exploitation.

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-09T20:18:28.000Z ##

Happy Patch Tuesday: Fortinet security advisories:

  • CVE-2023-48795 (5.3 medium): OpenSSH Terrapin attack (third party)
  • CVE-2023-37932 (6.2 medium): FortiVoice - Path traversal vulnerability in administrative interface
  • CVE-2023-48783 (4.9 medium): FortiPortal - Insufficient Access Control over API endpoints
  • CVE-2023-46712 (6.3 medium): FortiPortal - Account creation outside initial IdP
  • CVE-2023-37934 (4.2 medium): FortiPAM - Lack of rate control to protect against DoS attacks
  • CVE-2023-44250 (8.8 high): FortiOS & FortiProxy - Improper authorization for HA requests

No mention of exploitation.

CVE-2024-21337
(5.2 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.06%

2 posts

Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability

simontsui at 2024-01-11T21:27:53.462Z ##

Microsoft MSRC updated with five* security advisories related to Chromium. The unexpected part was all the additional information:

  • CVE-2024-20709 Adobe Systems Incorporated: CVE-2024-20709 Javascript Implementation PDF Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20675 (6.3 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2023-48631Adobe Systems Incorporated: CVE-2023-Improper Input Validation Denial of Service Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-0333 Chromium: CVE-2024-0333 Insufficient data validation in Extensions
  • CVE-2024-21337 (5.2 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability

CVE-2024-20709, CVE-2024-20675, CVE-2023-48631, CVE-2024-21337 are marked Not Publicly Disclosed, Not Exploited, and Exploitation Less Likely. CVE-2024-21337 was published 30 minutes later.

(8.8 HIGH)

2 posts

An improper privilege management vulnerability [CWE-269] in a Fortinet FortiOS HA cluster version 7.4.0 through 7.4.1 and 7.2.5 and in a FortiProxy HA cluster version 7.4.0 through 7.4.1 allows an authenticated attacker to perform elevated actions via crafted HTTP or HTTPS requests.

##

CVE-2024-20721
(5.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.05%

2 posts

Acrobat Reader T5 (MSFT Edge) versions 120.0.2210.91 and earlier are affected by an Improper Input Validation vulnerability. An unauthenticated attacker could leverage this vulnerability to achieve an application denial-of-service in the context of the current user. Exploitation of this issue requires user interaction in that a victim must open a malicious file.

simontsui at 2024-01-12T12:31:36.072Z ##

Microsoft's MSRC released one more security advisory 4 hours after the others hit my RSS feed:

  • CVE-2024-20721 Adobe Systems Incorporated: CVE-2024-20721 Improper Input Validation Denial of Service Vulnerability

It's weird how they titled it but included "Impact: Remote Code Execution". This was marked Not Publicly Disclosed, Not Exploited, and Exploitation Less Likely.

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-12T12:31:36.000Z ##

MSRC released one more security advisory 4 hours after the others hit my RSS feed:

  • CVE-2024-20721 Adobe Systems Incorporated: CVE-2024-20721 Improper Input Validation Denial of Service Vulnerability

It's weird how they titled it and also in included "Impact: Remote Code Execution". This was marked Not Publicly Disclosed, Not Exploited, and Exploitation Less Likely.

##

CVE-2024-20666
(6.6 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.05%

12 posts

BitLocker Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability

H3liumb0y at 2024-01-16T08:41:57.067Z ##

"🚨 Windows 10 Update Woes: The 0x80070643 Error Conundrum 🚨"

Microsoft is urgently addressing the 0x80070643 error disrupting Windows 10 updates. The culprit? A flawed KB5034441 security update patching CVE-2024-20666, a critical BitLocker vulnerability. This error surfaces on systems with insufficient Windows Recovery Environment (WinRE) partition space, misleadingly signaling an installation failure. 🔒💻

As a remedy, Microsoft has released a PowerShell script to automate the WinRE update, crucial for rectifying the BitLocker bypass issue. This proactive measure aims to shield against potential exploits targeting encrypted data. ⚔️🔐

Author: Sergiu Gatlan Source

Tags: #Microsoft #Windows10 #SecurityUpdate #CVE202420666 #BitLocker #CyberSecurity #Error0x80070643 #PatchTuesday #WinRE #PowerShell 🛡️💡

##
H3liumb0y@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-16T08:41:57.000Z ##

"🚨 Windows 10 Update Woes: The 0x80070643 Error Conundrum 🚨"

Microsoft is urgently addressing the 0x80070643 error disrupting Windows 10 updates. The culprit? A flawed KB5034441 security update patching CVE-2024-20666, a critical BitLocker vulnerability. This error surfaces on systems with insufficient Windows Recovery Environment (WinRE) partition space, misleadingly signaling an installation failure. 🔒💻

As a remedy, Microsoft has released a PowerShell script to automate the WinRE update, crucial for rectifying the BitLocker bypass issue. This proactive measure aims to shield against potential exploits targeting encrypted data. ⚔️🔐

Author: Sergiu Gatlan Source

Tags: #Microsoft #Windows10 #SecurityUpdate #CVE202420666 #BitLocker #CyberSecurity #Error0x80070643 #PatchTuesday #WinRE #PowerShell 🛡️💡

##
H3liumb0y@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-16T08:41:57.000Z ##

"🚨 Windows 10 Update Woes: The 0x80070643 Error Conundrum 🚨"

Microsoft is urgently addressing the 0x80070643 error disrupting Windows 10 updates. The culprit? A flawed KB5034441 security update patching CVE-2024-20666, a critical BitLocker vulnerability. This error surfaces on systems with insufficient Windows Recovery Environment (WinRE) partition space, misleadingly signaling an installation failure. 🔒💻

As a remedy, Microsoft has released a PowerShell script to automate the WinRE update, crucial for rectifying the BitLocker bypass issue. This proactive measure aims to shield against potential exploits targeting encrypted data. ⚔️🔐

Author: Sergiu Gatlan Source

Tags: #Microsoft #Windows10 #SecurityUpdate #CVE202420666 #BitLocker #CyberSecurity #Error0x80070643 #PatchTuesday #WinRE #PowerShell 🛡️💡

##
oversecurity@mastodon.social at 2024-01-15T19:50:06.000Z ##

Microsoft working on a fix for Windows 10 0x80070643 errors

Microsoft is working to fix a known issue causing 0x80070643 errors when installing the KB5034441 security update that patches the CVE-2024-20666...

🔗️ [Bleepingcomputer] https://link.is.it/h041q1

##
Sentry23 at 2024-01-15T09:26:59.329Z ##

So, #microsoft #patches KB5034122 and KB5034123 (Bitlocker encryption vuln CVE-2024-20666) are crapping out on what seems random systems due to an issue with a too small recovery partition.

The solution so far 'resize the recovery partition' is not a solution at schale.

Look, I know writing patches is not easy, but if you are Microsoft, there is no excuse for this.

#edit: on further reading: just another reason to always enable PIN when you deploy bitlocker:

If TPM+PIN BitLocker
protectors are being used, can the vulnerability be exploited if the attacker does not know the TPM PIN?

No. To exploit the vulnerability the attacker needs to know the TPM PIN if the user is protected by the BitLocker TPM+PIN.

##
3jackdaws@mastodon.social at 2024-01-11T21:37:53.000Z ##

"Cagada" de #Microsoft al desplegar en Windows10 el KB5034441 para solucionar la vulnerabilidad https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-20666. El parche no se instala por falta de espacio en la partición de recuperación (que M$ crea por defecto con aproximadamente 500MB al instalar). M$ ha publicado un procedimiento para solucionarlo que implica aumentar manualmente el tamaño de la partición en 250 MB.
https://www.tomshardware.com/software/windows/microsoft-kb5034441-windows-10-security-patch-for-bitlocker-bypass-is-leading-to-errors-and-has-a-complicated-fix

##
oversecurity@mastodon.social at 2024-01-11T18:50:05.000Z ##

Microsoft shares script to update Windows 10 WinRE with BitLocker fixes

Microsoft has released a PowerShell script to automate updating the Windows Recovery Environment (WinRE) partition in order to fix CVE-2024-20666,...

🔗️ [Bleepingcomputer] https://link.is.it/bk3e2b

##
fencepost at 2024-01-10T18:03:54.668Z ##

I have to admit, my immediate thoughts on the Bitlocker/WinRE vulnerability (local access required) were:
1) Oh hey, recovery without TPM sniffing
2) Reasons why you need to be able to remote-clear the TPM on managed remote devices (e.g. remote user laptops).
3) Reasons why Bitlocker alone isn't enough for situations where security is required vs security theater. Threat models matter.

CVE: https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-20666 "BitLocker Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability"

##
Sentry23@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-15T09:26:59.000Z ##

So, #microsoft #patches KB5034122 and KB5034123 (Bitlocker encryption vuln CVE-2024-20666) are crapping out on what seems random systems due to an issue with a too small recovery partition.

The solution so far 'resize the recovery partition' is not a solution at schale.

Look, I know writing patches is not easy, but if you are Microsoft, there is no excuse for this.

#edit: on further reading: just another reason to always enable PIN when you deploy bitlocker:

If TPM+PIN BitLocker
protectors are being used, can the vulnerability be exploited if the attacker does not know the TPM PIN?

No. To exploit the vulnerability the attacker needs to know the TPM PIN if the user is protected by the BitLocker TPM+PIN.

M$ ha publicado un procedimiento para solucionarlo que implica aumentar manualmente el tamaño de la partición en 250 MB.

##

CVE-2024-20674
(9.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.05%

9 posts

Windows Kerberos Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability

sk3w at 2024-01-18T17:26:22.061Z ##

Looks like MSRC changed the wording on the CVE-2024-20674 security bulletin since Jan 9. Which actually makes more sense, esp. when looking at the patch diffs.

#CVE_2024_20674 #kerberos

##
mttaggart@infosec.town at 2024-01-09T20:31:02.986Z ##

So this is the non-dislosed, no-exploit-detected, "worst" of the bunch this month: msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-20674

An unauthenticated attacker could exploit this vulnerability by establishing a machine-in-the-middle (MITM) attack or other local network spoofing technique, then sending a malicious Kerberos message to the client victim machine to spoof itself as the Kerberos authentication server.
Trying to think through this one.

#CVE_2024_20674 #ThreatIntel #PatchTuesday

##
mttaggart@infosec.town at 2024-01-09T20:31:02.986Z ##

So this is the non-dislosed, no-exploit-detected, "worst" of the bunch this month: msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-20674

An unauthenticated attacker could exploit this vulnerability by establishing a machine-in-the-middle (MITM) attack or other local network spoofing technique, then sending a malicious Kerberos message to the client victim machine to spoof itself as the Kerberos authentication server.
Trying to think through this one.

#CVE_2024_20674 #ThreatIntel #PatchTuesday

Microsoft starts off new year with relatively light Patch Tuesday, no zero-days

One of the critical vulnerabilities patched Tuesday is CVE-2024-20674, a security bypass vulnerability in the Windows Kerberos authentication...

🔗️ [Talosintelligence] https://link.is.it/zt5bcr

##
simontsui at 2024-01-09T18:44:11.283Z ##

I had too much free time and produced a list of what Microsoft considered "Exploitation More Likely" (their version of Exploit Prediction Scoring System (EPSS)):

  • CVE-2024-20674 (9.0 critical): Windows Kerberos Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-21318 (8.8 high): Microsoft SharePoint Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20683 (7.8 high): Win32k Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20698 (7.8 high): Windows Kernel Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20653 (7.8 high): Microsoft Common Log File System Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20686 (7.8 high): Win32k Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-21310 (7.8 high): Windows Cloud Files Mini Filter Driver Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-21307 (7.5 high): Remote Desktop Client Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20652 (7.5 high): Windows HTML Platforms Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability

Again, not publicly disclosed or exploited.

##
simontsui at 2024-01-09T18:25:13.213Z ##

Critical severity Microsoft vulnerabilities disclosed for January 2024 Patch Tuesday:

  • CVE-2024-0057 (9.1 critical): NET, .NET Framework, and Visual Studio Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20674 (9.0 critical): Windows Kerberos Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability

Again, not publicly disclosed or exploited.

I had too much free time and produced a list of what Microsoft considered "Exploitation More Likely" (their version of Exploit Prediction Scoring System (EPSS)):

  • CVE-2024-20674 (9.0 critical): Windows Kerberos Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-21318 (8.8 high): Microsoft SharePoint Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20683 (7.8 high): Win32k Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20698 (7.8 high): Windows Kernel Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20653 (7.8 high): Microsoft Common Log File System Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20686 (7.8 high): Win32k Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-21310 (7.8 high): Windows Cloud Files Mini Filter Driver Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-21307 (7.5 high): Remote Desktop Client Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20652 (7.5 high): Windows HTML Platforms Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability

Again, not publicly disclosed or exploited.

simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-09T18:25:13.000Z ##

Critical severity Microsoft vulnerabilities disclosed for January 2024 Patch Tuesday:

  • CVE-2024-0057 (9.1 critical): NET, .NET Framework, and Visual Studio Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20674 (9.0 critical): Windows Kerberos Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability

Again, not publicly disclosed or exploited.

(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

2 posts

simontsui at 2024-01-09T18:44:11.283Z ##

I had too much free time and produced a list of what Microsoft considered "Exploitation More Likely" (their version of Exploit Prediction Scoring System (EPSS)):

  • CVE-2024-20674 (9.0 critical): Windows Kerberos Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-21318 (8.8 high): Microsoft SharePoint Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20683 (7.8 high): Win32k Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20698 (7.8 high): Windows Kernel Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20653 (7.8 high): Microsoft Common Log File System Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability

##

CVE-2023-6546
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

2 posts

A race condition was found in the GSM 0710 tty multiplexor in the Linux kernel. This issue occurs when two threads execute the GSMIOC_SETCONF ioctl on the same tty file descriptor with the gsm line discipline enabled, and can lead to a use-after-free problem on a struct gsm_dlci while restarting the gsm mux. This could allow a local unprivileged user to escalate their privileges on the system.

raptor at 2024-01-20T06:58:32.905Z ##

#Linux #Kernel #GSM Multiplexing Race Condition Local Privilege Escalation #Vulnerability (CVE-2023-6546)

https://github.com/Nassim-Asrir/ZDI-24-020

##
raptor@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-20T06:58:32.000Z ##

#Linux #Kernel #GSM Multiplexing Race Condition Local Privilege Escalation #Vulnerability (CVE-2023-6546)

https://github.com/Nassim-Asrir/ZDI-24-020

CVE-2021-3620
(5.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

2 posts

Ansible is an IT automation system that handles configuration management, application deployment, cloud provisioning, ad-hoc task execution, network automation, and multi-node orchestration. A flaw was found in Ansible Engine's ansible-connection module where sensitive information, such as the Ansible user credentials, is disclosed by default in the traceback error message when Ansible receives an

CVE-2023-6027
(6.1 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

2 posts

A critical flaw has been identified in elijaa/phpmemcachedadmin affecting version 1.3.0, specifically related to a stored XSS vulnerability. This vulnerability allows malicious actors to insert a carefully crafted JavaScript payload. The issue arises from improper encoding of user-controlled entries in the "/pmcadmin/configure.php" parameter.

CVE-2023-22527
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

12 posts

Summary of Vulnerability A template injection vulnerability on older versions of Confluence Data Center and Server allows an unauthenticated attacker to achieve RCE on an affected instance. Customers using an affected version must take immediate action. Most recent supported versions of Confluence Data Center and Server are not affected by this vulnerability as it was ultimately mitigated during

2 repos

https://github.com/Sudistark/patch-diff-CVE-2023-22527

https://github.com/ga0we1/CVE-2023-22527_Confluence_RCE

simontsui at 2024-01-19T16:01:42.929Z ##

Rapid7 warns of both VMware RCE vulnerability CVE-2023-34048 (9.8 critical, disclosed 25 Octover 2023, under active exploitation) and Atlassian Confluence RCE vulnerability CVE-2023-22527 (10.0 critical, disclosed 16 January 2024).
🔗 https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2024/01/19/etr-critical-cves-in-outdated-versions-of-atlassian-confluence-and-vmware-vcenter-server/

#Atlassian #Confluence #RCE #vulnerability #activeexploitation #eitw #CVE202334048 #CVE202322527

##
simontsui at 2024-01-16T13:06:11.923Z ##

Atlassian security advisory: 28 high-severity vulnerabilities which have been fixed. I want to call attention to CVE-2023-22527, which has a maximum CVSSv3 score of 10.0 RCE (Remote Code Execution) Vulnerability in Out-of-Date Versions of Confluence Data Center and Server.
🔗 https://confluence.atlassian.com/security/security-bulletin-january-16-2024-1333335615.html

#AtlassianConfluence #Atlassian #securityadvisory #PatchTuesday #vulnerability #CVE202322527
