##
jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-01-16T18:00:05.000Z ##

Atlassian reveals critical Confluence RCE flaw, urges “immediate action” (CVE-2023-22527) https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2024/01/16/cve-2023-22527/ #AtlassianConfluence #securityupdate #vulnerability #enterprise #Don'tmiss #Atlassian #Hotstuff #News #CVE

##
decio at 2024-01-16T13:23:38.055Z ##

Avis de sécurité CVE-2023-22527

Atlassian annonce une vulnérabilité critique d'exécution de code à distance (RCE) dans les versions obsolètes de Confluence Data Center et Confluence Server. Les versions affectées comprennent les séries 8.0.x à 8.4.x et 8.5.0 à 8.5.3, publiées avant le 5 décembre 2023.

Atlassian recommande de mettre à jour immédiatement vers la version la plus récente pour corriger cette faille de sécurité (évaluée avec une criticité de 10 !) et se protéger contre d'autres vulnérabilités non critiques mentionnées dans le bulletin de sécurité de janvier d'Atlassian.
👇
https://confluence.atlassian.com/security/cve-2023-22527-rce-remote-code-execution-vulnerability-in-confluence-data-center-and-confluence-server-1333990257.html

#CyberVeille #Confluence #CVE_2023_22527

##
jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-01-16T18:00:05.000Z ##

Atlassian reveals critical Confluence RCE flaw, urges “immediate action” (CVE-2023-22527) https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2024/01/16/cve-2023-22527/ #AtlassianConfluence #securityupdate #vulnerability #enterprise #Don'tmiss #Atlassian #Hotstuff #News #CVE

##
decio@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-16T13:23:38.000Z ##

Avis de sécurité CVE-2023-22527

Atlassian annonce une vulnérabilité critique d'exécution de code à distance (RCE) dans les versions obsolètes de Confluence Data Center et Confluence Server. Les versions affectées comprennent les séries 8.0.x à 8.4.x et 8.5.0 à 8.5.3, publiées avant le 5 décembre 2023.

Atlassian recommande de mettre à jour immédiatement vers la version la plus récente pour corriger cette faille de sécurité (évaluée avec une criticité de 10 !) et se protéger contre d'autres vulnérabilités non critiques mentionnées dans le bulletin de sécurité de janvier d'Atlassian.
👇
https://confluence.atlassian.com/security/cve-2023-22527-rce-remote-code-execution-vulnerability-in-confluence-data-center-and-confluence-server-1333990257.html

#CyberVeille #Confluence #CVE_2023_22527

##

CVE-2024-0230(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

4 posts

A session management issue was addressed with improved checks. This issue is fixed in Magic Keyboard Firmware Update 2.0.6. An attacker with physical access to the accessory may be able to extract its Bluetooth pairing key and monitor Bluetooth traffic.

TomSellers at 2024-01-11T14:30:16.350Z ##

Kind of annoyed that the security fix for the Magic Keyboard isn't included on their "Apple security releases" page. I hope it's just an oversight.

It's not a major issue for most folks but I like it when authoritative sources of security info are complete and comprehensive.

Magic Keyboard Firmware Update 2.0.6

CVE-2024-0230: An attacker with physical access to the accessory may be able to extract its Bluetooth pairing key and monitor Bluetooth traffic

https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT214050

Apple security releases page
https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT201222

#Security #bluetooth #apple

##
simontsui at 2024-01-11T14:27:57.769Z ##

Apple security advisory: About the security content of Magic Keyboard Firmware Update 2.0.6

  • CVE-2024-0230 session management vulnerability. An attacker with physical access to the accessory may be able to extract its Bluetooth pairing key and monitor Bluetooth traffic

No mention of exploitation.
🔗 https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT214050

CVE-2023-37934
(4.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

2 posts

An allocation of resources without limits or throttling vulnerability [CWE-770] in FortiPAM 1.0 all versions allows an authenticated attacker to perform a denial of service attack via sending crafted HTTP or HTTPS requests in a high frequency.

simontsui at 2024-01-09T20:18:28.761Z ##

Happy Patch Tuesday: Fortinet security advisories:

  • CVE-2023-48795 (5.3 medium): OpenSSH Terrapin attack (third party)
  • CVE-2023-37932 (6.2 medium): FortiVoice - Path traversal vulnerability in administrative interface
  • CVE-2023-48783 (4.9 medium): FortiPortal - Insufficient Access Control over API endpoints
  • CVE-2023-46712 (6.3 medium): FortiPortal - Account creation outside initial IdP
  • CVE-2023-37934 (4.2 medium): FortiPAM - Lack of rate control to protect against DoS attacks
  • CVE-2023-44250 (8.8 high): FortiOS & FortiProxy - Improper authorization for HA requests

No mention of exploitation.

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-09T20:18:28.000Z ##

  • CVE-2023-48795 (5.3 medium): OpenSSH Terrapin attack (third party)
  • CVE-2023-37932 (6.2 medium): FortiVoice - Path traversal vulnerability in administrative interface

  • CVE-2023-37934 (4.2 medium): FortiPAM - Lack of rate control to protect against DoS attacks

CVE-2024-22165
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

2 posts

In Splunk Enterprise Security (ES) versions lower than 7.1.2, an attacker can create a malformed Investigation to perform a denial of service (DoS). The malformed investigation prevents the generation and rendering of the Investigations manager until it is deleted.
The vulnerability requires an authenticated session and access to create an Investigation. It only affects the availability of the

##

CVE-2024-22164
(4.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

2 posts

In Splunk Enterprise Security (ES) versions below 7.1.2, an attacker can use investigation attachments to perform a denial of service (DoS) to the Investigation. The attachment endpoint does not properly limit the size of the request which lets an attacker cause the Investigation to become inaccessible.

(5.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

2 posts

Use of Java's default temporary directory for file creation in `FileBackedOutputStream` in Google Guava versions 1.0 to 31.1 on Unix systems and Android Ice Cream Sandwich allows other users and apps on the machine with access to the default Java temporary directory to be able to access the files created by the class. Even though the security vulnerability is fixed in version 32.0.0, maintainers

CVE-2023-43786
(5.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

2 posts

A vulnerability was found in libX11 due to an infinite loop within the PutSubImage() function. This flaw allows a local user to consume all available system resources and cause a denial of service condition.

1 repos

https://github.com/jfrog/jfrog-CVE-2023-43786-libX11_DoS

raptor at 2024-01-20T07:04:47.960Z ##

*nix #libX11: Uncovering and exploiting a 35-year-old #vulnerability – Part 1 of 2 by @jfrog

https://jfrog.com/blog/xorg-libx11-vulns-cve-2023-43786-cve-2023-43787-part-one/

Happy to see that other researchers are building upon my previous work

https://security.humanativaspa.it/nothing-new-under-the-sun/

https://github.com/0xdea/advisories/blob/master/HNS-2022-01-dtprintinfo.txt

CVE-2023-43787
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

2 posts

A vulnerability was found in libX11 due to an integer overflow within the XCreateImage() function. This flaw allows a local user to trigger an integer overflow and execute arbitrary code with elevated privileges.

CVE-2023-6548
(5.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.00%

16 posts

Improper Control of Generation of Code ('Code Injection') in NetScaler ADC and NetScaler Gateway allows an attacker with access to NSIP, CLIP or SNIP with management interface to perform Authenticated (low privileged) remote code execution on Management Interface.

simontsui at 2024-01-18T17:57:21.303Z ##

CISA buries the lede in their cybersecurity alert about Citrix NetScaler ADC and NetScaler Gateway, by not mentioning that CVE-2023-6548 and CVE-2023-6549 are exploited zero-days. See the KEV Catalog announcement that this toot is a reply to.
🔗 https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/01/18/citrix-releases-security-updates-netscaler-adc-and-netscaler-gateway
"Exploits of these CVEs on unmitigated appliances have been observed."

#CISA #securityadvisory #CVE20236548 #CVE20236549 #Citrix #NetScaler #ADC #zeroday #activeexploitation #eitw

##
simontsui at 2024-01-17T16:37:11.731Z ##

CISA Adds Three Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog:

  • CVE-2023-6549 Citrix NetScaler ADC and NetScaler Gateway Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
  • CVE-2023-6548 Citrix NetScaler ADC and NetScaler Gateway Code Injection Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-0519 Google Chromium V8 Out-of-Bounds Memory Access Vulnerability

🔗 https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/01/17/cisa-adds-three-known-exploited-vulnerabilities-catalog

#CISA #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CVE20236548 #CVE20236549 #CVE20240519 #Chrome #Google #Citrix #NetScaler #ADC #activeexploitation #eitw #vulnerability

##
simontsui at 2024-01-16T12:46:52.256Z ##

Citrix security advisory contains two zero-days: Two vulnerabilities have been discovered in NetScaler ADC (formerly Citrix ADC) and NetScaler Gateway (formerly Citrix Gateway):

  • CVE-2023-6548 (5.5 medium) Authenticated (low privileged) remote code execution on Management Interface
  • CVE-2023-6549 (8.2 high) Denial of Service

"Exploits of these CVEs on unmitigated appliances have been observed."
🔗 https://support.citrix.com/article/CTX584986/netscaler-adc-and-netscaler-gateway-security-bulletin-for-cve20236548-and-cve20236549

#CVE20236548 #CVE20236549 #Citrix #vulnerability #securityadvisory #Netscaler #PatchTuesday

##
j0hnb3r00t at 2024-01-18T09:43:34.284Z ##

CVE-2023-6548 and CVE-2023-6549 #citrix

##
simontsui at 2024-01-17T16:49:42.722Z ##

CISA put a 1 week deadline on CVE-2023-6548 whereas CVE-2023-6549 and CVE-2024-0519 have a 3 week deadline. This is likely because CVE- 2023- 6548 only impacts the management interface, and the management interface should NOT be exposed to the internet in the first place.

##
j0hnb3r00t@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-18T09:43:34.000Z ##

CVE-2023-6548 and CVE-2023-6549 #citrix

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-17T16:49:42.000Z ##

CISA put a 1 week deadline on CVE-2023-6548 whereas CVE-2023-6549 and CVE-2024-0519 have a 3 week deadline. This is likely because CVE- 2023- 6548 only impacts the management interface, and the management interface should NOT be exposed to the internet in the first place.

🔗 https://support.citrix.com/article/CTX584986/netscaler-adc-and-netscaler-gateway-security-bulletin-for-cve20236548-and-cve20236549

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-18T17:57:21.000Z ##

CISA buries the lede in their cybersecurity alert about Citrix NetScaler ADC and NetScaler Gateway, by not mentioning that CVE-2023-6548 and CVE-2023-6549 are exploited zero-days. See the KEV Catalog announcement that this toot is a reply to.
🔗 https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/01/18/citrix-releases-security-updates-netscaler-adc-and-netscaler-gateway
"Exploits of these CVEs on unmitigated appliances have been observed."

#CISA #securityadvisory #CVE20236548 #CVE20236549 #Citrix #NetScaler #ADC #zeroday #activeexploitation #eitw

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-17T16:37:11.000Z ##

CISA Adds Three Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog:

  • CVE-2023-6549 Citrix NetScaler ADC and NetScaler Gateway Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
  • CVE-2023-6548 Citrix NetScaler ADC and NetScaler Gateway Code Injection Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-0519 Google Chromium V8 Out-of-Bounds Memory Access Vulnerability

🔗 https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/01/17/cisa-adds-three-known-exploited-vulnerabilities-catalog

#CISA #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CVE20236548 #CVE20236549 #CVE20240519 #Chrome #Google #Citrix #NetScaler #ADC #activeexploitation #eitw #vulnerability

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-16T12:46:52.000Z ##

Citrix security advisory contains two zero-days: Two vulnerabilities have been discovered in NetScaler ADC (formerly Citrix ADC) and NetScaler Gateway (formerly Citrix Gateway):

  • CVE-2023-6548 (5.5 medium) Authenticated (low privileged) remote code execution on Management Interface
  • CVE-2023-6549 (8.2 high) Denial of Service

"Exploits of these CVEs on unmitigated appliances have been observed."
🔗 https://support.citrix.com/article/CTX584986/netscaler-adc-and-netscaler-gateway-security-bulletin-for-cve20236548-and-cve20236549

##
j0hnb3r00t at 2024-01-18T09:43:34.284Z ##

CVE-2023-6548 and CVE-2023-6549 #citrix

##
simontsui at 2024-01-17T16:49:42.722Z ##

CISA put a 1 week deadline on CVE-2023-6548 whereas CVE-2023-6549 and CVE-2024-0519 have a 3 week deadline. This is likely because CVE- 2023- 6548 only impacts the management interface, and the management interface should NOT be exposed to the internet in the first place.

##
j0hnb3r00t@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-18T09:43:34.000Z ##

CVE-2023-6548 and CVE-2023-6549 #citrix

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-17T16:49:42.000Z ##

CISA put a 1 week deadline on CVE-2023-6548 whereas CVE-2023-6549 and CVE-2024-0519 have a 3 week deadline. This is likely because CVE- 2023- 6548 only impacts the management interface, and the management interface should NOT be exposed to the internet in the first place.

##

CVE-2024-0519
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

21 posts

Out of bounds memory access in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 120.0.6099.224 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

simontsui at 2024-01-17T19:08:31.280Z ##

Microsoft MSRC published three security advisories:

  • CVE-2024-0517Chromium: CVE-2024-0517 Out of bounds write in V8
  • CVE-2024-0518 Chromium: CVE-2024-0518 Type Confusion in V8
  • CVE-2024-0519 Chromium: CVE-2024-0519 Out of bounds memory access in V8

Note: "Google is aware of reports that an exploit for CVE-2024-0519 exists in the wild." Google marked these vulnerabilities as high severity.

#Microsoft #MSRC #Google #Chrome #activeexploitation #CVE20240519 #zeroday

##
avoidthehack at 2024-01-17T15:54:28.220Z ##

#Google fixes first actively exploited #Chrome zero-day of 2024

Tracked as CVE-2024-0519. Out-of-bounds read in the V8 JavaScript engine. Likely affects all Chromium browsers so be sure to update.

Disclaimer: avoid using Google Chrome… it sucks for #privacy.

#cybersecurity #security #cve

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/google-fixes-first-actively-exploited-chrome-zero-day-of-2024/

##

CVE-2021-77577
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

4 posts

N/A

simontsui at 2024-01-18T15:13:57.426Z ##

VulnCheck wrote about 7777-Botnet with the following information:

  • 7777-Botnet remains active, and VulnCheck used co-located services to theorize the botnet is infecting TP-Link, Xiongmai, and Hikvision devices using CVE-2017-7577, CVE-2018-10088, CVE-2022-45460, CVE-2021-36260, and/or CVE-2022-24355.
  • The botnet also appears to infect other systems like MVPower, Zyxel NAS, and GitLab, although at a very low volume.
  • The botnet doesn’t just start a service on port 7777. It also spins up a SOCKS5 server on port 11228.

🔗 https://vulncheck.com/blog/ip-intel-7777-botnet

#7777Botnet #botnet #TPLink #Xiongmai #Hikvision #CVE202177577 #CVE201810088 #CVE202245460 #CVE202136260 #CVE202224355 #MVPower #Zyxel #GitLab

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-18T15:13:57.000Z ##

VulnCheck wrote about 7777-Botnet with the following information:

  • 7777-Botnet remains active, and VulnCheck used co-located services to theorize the botnet is infecting TP-Link, Xiongmai, and Hikvision devices using CVE-2017-7577, CVE-2018-10088, CVE-2022-45460, CVE-2021-36260, and/or CVE-2022-24355.
  • The botnet also appears to infect other systems like MVPower, Zyxel NAS, and GitLab, although at a very low volume.
  • The botnet doesn’t just start a service on port 7777. It also spins up a SOCKS5 server on port 11228.

##

CVE-2024-20270
(4.8 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.00%

4 posts

A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of Cisco BroadWorks Application Delivery Platform and Cisco BroadWorks Xtended Services Platform could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to conduct a stored cross-site scripting (XSS) attack against a user of the interface. This vulnerability exists because the web-based management interface does not properly validate user-supplied inpu

h4sh at 2024-01-21T22:47:13.064Z ##

Ok the github api is so much easier:

`curl 'https://api.github.com/advisories?cve_id=CVE-2024-20270' | jq .[].cvss.score`

##
simontsui at 2024-01-10T16:48:38.112Z ##

Cisco coming in a day late for Patch Tuesday with the following 7 advisories:

  • CVE-2024-20251 (4.8 medium): Cisco Identity Services Engine Stored Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability
  • CVE-2023-20248, CVE-2023-20249 (5.4 medium) Cisco TelePresence Management Suite Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerabilities
  • CVE-2024-20277 (6.8 medium): Cisco ThousandEyes Enterprise Agent Virtual Appliance Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20287 (6.5 medium severity): Cisco WAP371 Wireless Access Point Command Injection Vulnerability
    • NOTE: The Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) is aware that proof-of-concept exploit code is available for the vulnerability described in this advisory
  • Multiple CVE IDs (6.5 medium): Cisco Evolved Programmable Network Manager and Cisco Prime Infrastructure Vulnerabilities
  • CVE-2024-20272 (7.3 high): Cisco Unity Connection Unauthenticated Arbitrary File Upload Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20270 (4.8 medium): Cisco BroadWorks Application Delivery Platform and Xtended Services Platform Stored Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability

CVE-2024-20287 has PoC, making it a zero-day.

##
h4sh@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-21T22:47:13.000Z ##

Ok the github api is so much easier:

`curl 'https://api.github.com/advisories?cve_id=CVE-2024-20270' | jq .[].cvss.score`

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-10T16:48:38.000Z ##

Cisco coming in a day late for Patch Tuesday with the following 7 advisories:

  • CVE-2024-20251 (4.8 medium): Cisco Identity Services Engine Stored Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability
  • CVE-2023-20248, CVE-2023-20249 (5.4 medium) Cisco TelePresence Management Suite Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerabilities
  • CVE-2024-20277 (6.8 medium): Cisco ThousandEyes Enterprise Agent Virtual Appliance Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20287 (6.5 medium severity): Cisco WAP371 Wireless Access Point Command Injection Vulnerability
    • NOTE: The Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) is aware that proof-of-concept exploit code is available for the vulnerability described in this advisory
  • Multiple CVE IDs (6.5 medium): Cisco Evolved Programmable Network Manager and Cisco Prime Infrastructure Vulnerabilities
  • CVE-2024-20272 (7.3 high): Cisco Unity Connection Unauthenticated Arbitrary File Upload Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20270 (4.8 medium): Cisco BroadWorks Application Delivery Platform and Xtended Services Platform Stored Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability

CVE-2024-20287 has PoC, making it a zero-day.

CVE-2024-22145

##

CVE-2024-0679
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.00%

2 posts

The ColorMag theme for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized access due to a missing capability check on the plugin_action_callback() function in all versions up to, and including, 3.1.2. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with subscriber-level access and above, to install and activate arbitrary plugins.

1 repos

https://github.com/RandomRobbieBF/CVE-2024-0679

random_robbie at 2024-01-19T22:51:26.864Z ##

https://github.com/RandomRobbieBF/CVE-2024-0679

##
random_robbie@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-19T22:51:26.000Z ##

https://github.com/RandomRobbieBF/CVE-2024-0679

CVE-2024-23525(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.00%

2 posts

The Spreadsheet::ParseXLSX package before 0.30 for Perl allows XXE attacks because it neglects to use the no_xxe option of XML::Twig.

nuddlegg@fosstodon.org at 2024-01-18T12:13:20.000Z ##

CVE-2024-23525 has been fixed in latest release of Spreadsheet::ParseXLSX

https://metacpan.org/dist/Spreadsheet-ParseXLSX

#perl #cve #security #xxe

##
nuddlegg@fosstodon.org at 2024-01-18T12:13:20.000Z ##

https://metacpan.org/dist/Spreadsheet-ParseXLSX

##

CVE-2024-20272
(7.3 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

10 posts

A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of Cisco Unity Connection could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to upload arbitrary files to an affected system and execute commands on the underlying operating system. This vulnerability is due to a lack of authentication in a specific API and improper validation of user-supplied data. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by

h4sh at 2024-01-18T11:57:52.149Z ##

@simontsui yea CVE-2024-20272 should be a 9.8 - unauthenticated RCE leading to root access is always at least that (if not 10.0)

Vendor CNAs are not mandated to do the right thing, there is no contract between MITRE and partner CNAs to tell them what to do, and some companies (like Apple) don't even publish CVSS

#cisco #cve

##
jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-01-12T02:30:04.000Z ##

Cisco fixed critical Unity Connection vulnerability CVE-2024-20272 – Source: securityaffairs.com https://ciso2ciso.com/cisco-fixed-critical-unity-connection-vulnerability-cve-2024-20272-source-securityaffairs-com/ #rssfeedpostgeneratorecho #informationsecuritynews #ITInformationSecurity #SecurityAffairscom #CyberSecurityNews #PierluigiPaganini #SecurityAffairs #SecurityAffairs #UnityConnection #BreakingNews #SecurityNews #hackingnews #Security #hacking #Cisco

##
simontsui at 2024-01-11T15:37:22.030Z ##

SOCRadar emphasizes the criticality of Cisco Unity Connection Unauthenticated Arbitrary File Upload Vulnerability. While CVE-2024-20272 has a CVSSv3 score of 7.3 and high severity, you should read carefully into the description in the security advisory: "An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by uploading arbitrary files to an affected system. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to store malicious files on the system, execute arbitrary commands on the operating system, and elevate privileges to root." This is one reason why you should not rely on just CVSSv3 scores alone.
🔗 https://socradar.io/high-severity-vulnerability-in-cisco-unity-connection-could-enable-root-privileges-cve-2024-20272/

##
jbhall56 at 2024-01-11T13:34:53.985Z ##

Tracked as CVE-2024-20272 (CVSS score: 7.3), the vulnerability is an arbitrary file upload bug residing in the web-based management interface and is the result of a lack of authentication in a specific API and improper validation of user-supplied data. https://thehackernews.com/2024/01/cisco-fixes-high-risk-vulnerability.html

##
jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-01-11T12:25:06.000Z ##

Critical Cisco Unity Connection flaw gives attackers root privileges. Patch now! (CVE-2024-20272) https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2024/01/11/cve-2024-20272/ #securityupdate #vulnerability #Don'tmiss #Hotstuff #Cisco #News

##
simontsui at 2024-01-10T16:48:38.112Z ##

Cisco coming in a day late for Patch Tuesday with the following 7 advisories:

  • CVE-2024-20251 (4.8 medium): Cisco Identity Services Engine Stored Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability
  • CVE-2023-20248, CVE-2023-20249 (5.4 medium) Cisco TelePresence Management Suite Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerabilities
  • CVE-2024-20277 (6.8 medium): Cisco ThousandEyes Enterprise Agent Virtual Appliance Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20287 (6.5 medium severity): Cisco WAP371 Wireless Access Point Command Injection Vulnerability
    • NOTE: The Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) is aware that proof-of-concept exploit code is available for the vulnerability described in this advisory
  • Multiple CVE IDs (6.5 medium): Cisco Evolved Programmable Network Manager and Cisco Prime Infrastructure Vulnerabilities
  • CVE-2024-20272 (7.3 high): Cisco Unity Connection Unauthenticated Arbitrary File Upload Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20270 (4.8 medium): Cisco BroadWorks Application Delivery Platform and Xtended Services Platform Stored Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability

CVE-2024-20287 has PoC, making it a zero-day.

##
h4sh@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-18T11:57:52.000Z ##

simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-11T15:37:22.000Z ##

SOCRadar emphasizes the criticality of Cisco Unity Connection Unauthenticated Arbitrary File Upload Vulnerability. While CVE-2024-20272 has a CVSSv3 score of 7.3 and high severity, you should read carefully into the description in the security advisory: "An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by uploading arbitrary files to an affected system. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to store malicious files on the system, execute arbitrary commands on the operating system, and elevate privileges to root." This is one reason why you should not rely on just CVSSv3 scores alone.
🔗 https://socradar.io/high-severity-vulnerability-in-cisco-unity-connection-could-enable-root-privileges-cve-2024-20272/

simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-10T16:48:38.000Z ##

Cisco coming in a day late for Patch Tuesday with the following 7 advisories:

  • CVE-2024-20251 (4.8 medium): Cisco Identity Services Engine Stored Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability
  • CVE-2023-20248, CVE-2023-20249 (5.4 medium) Cisco TelePresence Management Suite Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerabilities
  • CVE-2024-20277 (6.8 medium): Cisco ThousandEyes Enterprise Agent Virtual Appliance Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20287 (6.5 medium severity): Cisco WAP371 Wireless Access Point Command Injection Vulnerability
    • NOTE: The Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) is aware that proof-of-concept exploit code is available for the vulnerability described in this advisory
  • Multiple CVE IDs (6.5 medium): Cisco Evolved Programmable Network Manager and Cisco Prime Infrastructure Vulnerabilities
  • CVE-2024-20272 (7.3 high): Cisco Unity Connection Unauthenticated Arbitrary File Upload Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20270 (4.8 medium): Cisco BroadWorks Application Delivery Platform and Xtended Services Platform Stored Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability

CVE-2024-20287 has PoC, making it a zero-day.

CVE-2024-0517(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.00%

2 posts

Out of bounds write in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 120.0.6099.224 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

simontsui at 2024-01-17T19:08:31.280Z ##

Microsoft MSRC published three security advisories:

  • CVE-2024-0517Chromium: CVE-2024-0517 Out of bounds write in V8
  • CVE-2024-0518 Chromium: CVE-2024-0518 Type Confusion in V8
  • CVE-2024-0519 Chromium: CVE-2024-0519 Out of bounds memory access in V8

Note: "Google is aware of reports that an exploit for CVE-2024-0519 exists in the wild." Google marked these vulnerabilities as high severity.

#Microsoft #MSRC #Google #Chrome #activeexploitation #CVE20240519 #zeroday

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-17T19:08:31.000Z ##

Microsoft MSRC published three security advisories:

  • CVE-2024-0517Chromium: CVE-2024-0517 Out of bounds write in V8
  • CVE-2024-0518 Chromium: CVE-2024-0518 Type Confusion in V8
  • CVE-2024-0519 Chromium: CVE-2024-0519 Out of bounds memory access in V8

Note: "Google is aware of reports that an exploit for CVE-2024-0519 exists in the wild." Google marked these vulnerabilities as high severity.

##

CVE-2023-45235
(8.3 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

2 posts

EDK2's Network Package is susceptible to a buffer overflow vulnerability when handling Server ID option from a DHCPv6 proxy Advertise message. This vulnerability can be exploited by an attacker to gain unauthorized access and potentially lead to a loss of Confidentiality, Integrity and/or Availability.

4Dgifts@mastodon.social at 2024-01-16T18:35:02.000Z ##

@mttaggart CVE-2023-45230, CVE-2023-45234 and CVE-2023-45235 are buffer overflows. The first one is straight forward. We have not provided exploits, just ways of reproducing the vulns. Writing a exploit would be doing it tailored to the specific targets but note UEFI firmware does not have any exploit mitigations. Depending what you consider "successful exploitation" YMMV.

##
4Dgifts@mastodon.social at 2024-01-16T18:35:02.000Z ##

@mttaggart CVE-2023-45230, CVE-2023-45234 and CVE-2023-45235 are buffer overflows. The first one is straight forward. We have not provided exploits, just ways of reproducing the vulns. Writing a exploit would be doing it tailored to the specific targets but note UEFI firmware does not have any exploit mitigations. Depending what you consider "successful exploitation" YMMV.

CVE-2023-45230
(8.3 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

2 posts

EDK2's Network Package is susceptible to a buffer overflow vulnerability via a long server ID option in DHCPv6 client. This vulnerability can be exploited by an attacker to gain unauthorized access and potentially lead to a loss of Confidentiality, Integrity and/or Availability.

(5.4 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.00%

2 posts

  Cross-site scripting (XSS)

simontsui at 2024-01-16T14:11:12.123Z ##

Citrix security advisory: CVE-2023-5914 (5.4 medium) for Citrix StoreFront. Cross-site scripting (XSS). Pre-requisite: Requires victim to access an attacker-controlled link in the browser. No mention of exploitation being observed.
🔗 https://support.citrix.com/article/CTX583759/citrix-storefront-security-bulletin-for-cve20235914

#Citrix #CitrixStoreFront #securityadvisory #PatchTuesday #vulnerability #CVE20235914

(5.0 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.00%

2 posts

Cross SiteScripting vulnerability in Citrix Session Recording allows attacker to perform Cross Site Scripting

simontsui at 2024-01-16T14:08:07.474Z ##

Citrix security advisory: CVE-2023-6184 (5.0 medium) for Session Recording: An authenticated user can perform RCE. Pre-requisite: Attacker must possess admin privileges to the Session Recording server. No mention of exploitation being observed.

CVE-2024-20287
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.00%

4 posts

A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of the Cisco WAP371 Wireless-AC/N Dual Radio Access Point (AP) with Single Point Setup could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to perform command injection attacks against an affected device. This vulnerability is due to improper validation of user-supplied input. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending crafted HTTP reques

simontsui at 2024-01-10T16:48:38.112Z ##

Cisco coming in a day late for Patch Tuesday with the following 7 advisories:

  • CVE-2024-20251 (4.8 medium): Cisco Identity Services Engine Stored Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability
  • CVE-2023-20248, CVE-2023-20249 (5.4 medium) Cisco TelePresence Management Suite Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerabilities
  • CVE-2024-20277 (6.8 medium): Cisco ThousandEyes Enterprise Agent Virtual Appliance Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20287 (6.5 medium severity): Cisco WAP371 Wireless Access Point Command Injection Vulnerability
    • NOTE: The Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) is aware that proof-of-concept exploit code is available for the vulnerability described in this advisory
  • Multiple CVE IDs (6.5 medium): Cisco Evolved Programmable Network Manager and Cisco Prime Infrastructure Vulnerabilities
  • CVE-2024-20272 (7.3 high): Cisco Unity Connection Unauthenticated Arbitrary File Upload Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20270 (4.8 medium): Cisco BroadWorks Application Delivery Platform and Xtended Services Platform Stored Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability

CVE-2024-20287 has PoC, making it a zero-day.

##
simontsui at 2024-01-10T16:28:49.005Z ##

Wake up babe, new Cisco Zero-Day dropped: CVE-2024-20287 (6.5 medium severity) Cisco WAP371 Wireless Access Point Command Injection Vulnerability.

The Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) is aware that proof-of-concept exploit code is available for the vulnerability described in this advisory.
🔗 https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-sb-wap-inject-bHStWgXO

Note: Cisco has not released and will not release firmware updates to address the vulnerability that is described in this advisory. The Cisco WAP371 Wireless-AC/N AP with Single Point Setup has entered the end-of-life process.

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-10T16:48:38.000Z ##

  • CVE-2024-20251 (4.8 medium): Cisco Identity Services Engine Stored Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability
  • CVE-2023-20248, CVE-2023-20249 (5.4 medium) Cisco TelePresence Management Suite Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerabilities
  • CVE-2024-20277 (6.8 medium): Cisco ThousandEyes Enterprise Agent Virtual Appliance Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20287 (6.5 medium severity): Cisco WAP371 Wireless Access Point Command Injection Vulnerability
    • NOTE: The Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) is aware that proof-of-concept exploit code is available for the vulnerability described in this advisory
  • Multiple CVE IDs (6.5 medium): Cisco Evolved Programmable Network Manager and Cisco Prime Infrastructure Vulnerabilities
  • CVE-2024-20272 (7.3 high): Cisco Unity Connection Unauthenticated Arbitrary File Upload Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20270 (4.8 medium): Cisco BroadWorks Application Delivery Platform and Xtended Services Platform Stored Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability

CVE-2024-20287 has PoC, making it a zero-day.

simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-10T16:28:49.000Z ##

Wake up babe, new Cisco Zero-Day dropped: CVE-2024-20287 (6.5 medium severity) Cisco WAP371 Wireless Access Point Command Injection Vulnerability.

The Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) is aware that proof-of-concept exploit code is available for the vulnerability described in this advisory.
🔗 https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-sb-wap-inject-bHStWgXO

Note: Cisco has not released and will not release firmware updates to address the vulnerability that is described in this advisory. The Cisco WAP371 Wireless-AC/N AP with Single Point Setup has entered the end-of-life process.

CVE-2024-20251
(4.8 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.00%

2 posts

A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of Cisco Identity Services Engine (ISE) could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to perform a stored cross-site scripting (XSS) attack against a user of the interface on an affected device. This vulnerability exists because the web-based management interface does not properly validate user-supplied input. An attacker could exploit this vul

simontsui at 2024-01-10T16:48:38.112Z ##

Cisco coming in a day late for Patch Tuesday with the following 7 advisories:

  • CVE-2024-20251 (4.8 medium): Cisco Identity Services Engine Stored Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability
  • CVE-2023-20248, CVE-2023-20249 (5.4 medium) Cisco TelePresence Management Suite Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerabilities
  • CVE-2024-20277 (6.8 medium): Cisco ThousandEyes Enterprise Agent Virtual Appliance Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20287 (6.5 medium severity): Cisco WAP371 Wireless Access Point Command Injection Vulnerability
    • NOTE: The Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) is aware that proof-of-concept exploit code is available for the vulnerability described in this advisory
  • Multiple CVE IDs (6.5 medium): Cisco Evolved Programmable Network Manager and Cisco Prime Infrastructure Vulnerabilities
  • CVE-2024-20272 (7.3 high): Cisco Unity Connection Unauthenticated Arbitrary File Upload Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20270 (4.8 medium): Cisco BroadWorks Application Delivery Platform and Xtended Services Platform Stored Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability

CVE-2024-20287 has PoC, making it a zero-day.

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-10T16:48:38.000Z ##

Cisco coming in a day late for Patch Tuesday with the following 7 advisories:

  • CVE-2024-20251 (4.8 medium): Cisco Identity Services Engine Stored Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability
  • CVE-2023-20248, CVE-2023-20249 (5.4 medium) Cisco TelePresence Management Suite Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerabilities
  • CVE-2024-20277 (6.8 medium): Cisco ThousandEyes Enterprise Agent Virtual Appliance Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20287 (6.5 medium severity): Cisco WAP371 Wireless Access Point Command Injection Vulnerability
    • NOTE: The Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) is aware that proof-of-concept exploit code is available for the vulnerability described in this advisory
  • Multiple CVE IDs (6.5 medium): Cisco Evolved Programmable Network Manager and Cisco Prime Infrastructure Vulnerabilities
  • CVE-2024-20272 (7.3 high): Cisco Unity Connection Unauthenticated Arbitrary File Upload Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20270 (4.8 medium): Cisco BroadWorks Application Delivery Platform and Xtended Services Platform Stored Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability

CVE-2024-20287 has PoC, making it a zero-day.

##

CVE-2024-20277
(6.8 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.00%

2 posts

A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of Cisco ThousandEyes Enterprise Agent, Virtual Appliance installation type, could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to perform a command injection and elevate privileges to root. This vulnerability is due to insufficient validation of user-supplied input for the web interface. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a cra

CVE-2024-46188
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

2 posts

N/A

nbwpuk at 2024-01-09T15:46:05.049Z ##

Important Security Notice: WordPress administrators being actively targeted with phishing campaign

It has come to our attention that a fraudulent phishing campaign is actively targeting administrators of WordPress websites.

The attackers are sending emails with the subject line "URGENT: Vulnerability found - Your website [DOMAIN] is at risk!" The email claims to be from the WordPress Security Team and insists on addressing a critical Remote Code Execution (RCE) vulnerability affecting your website. It urges users to download a plugin labelled as "CVE-2024-46188 Patch" to mitigate the alleged threat.

READ MORE: https://encode.host/announcements/64/Important-Security-Notice-WordPress-administrators-being-actively-targeted-with-phishing-campaign.html

#WordPress #security #malware #phishing

##
nbwpuk@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-09T15:46:05.000Z ##

Important Security Notice: WordPress administrators being actively targeted with phishing campaign

It has come to our attention that a fraudulent phishing campaign is actively targeting administrators of WordPress websites.

The attackers are sending emails with the subject line "URGENT: Vulnerability found - Your website [DOMAIN] is at risk!" The email claims to be from the WordPress Security Team and insists on addressing a critical Remote Code Execution (RCE) vulnerability affecting your website. It urges users to download a plugin labelled as "CVE-2024-46188 Patch" to mitigate the alleged threat.

READ MORE: https://encode.host/announcements/64/Important-Security-Notice-WordPress-administrators-being-actively-targeted-with-phishing-campaign.html

#WordPress #security #malware #phishing
